giueth v wil abilitie performe wil haue seen another textphil b yit god worketh v gracious fauour good work done called good sooth led wee go bee woondered god goodnesse stretcheth farre make thing whereof deserueth prayse wee call bread wee eate owne though wee haue tytle gift although men take payne yit could stand stead god free blissing looke giuen v wee call owne euen paule exhorteth v put newe man wee doo selues iesus christ must bee fayne clothe v ryghtuousnesse well make v parttakers giftes holy spirit praye ment putting new man haue tolde already vtter chaunging v thought desyres bee short partes soule alteration speciall woorke god gift hys holy spirit saint paule therefore meaneth wee doo thing owne power yit euery v ought streyne himselfe followe whither soeuer calleth v therewithall warneth v lyfe daungerful vntill wee chaunge newnesse appeere v saint paule sayeth nevve man created god image therin confirmeth matter go touch wit although wee streyne selues vttermost wee yit wee doo nothing vnlesse wee bee preuented god grace v bee owne maker wee knowe honour must bee reserued vntoo god alone heere cace standeth vppon new creating therefore cannot bee man yit power saynt paule also hath dispatched doubt scruple saying newe man created god say frendes dede ye ought abuse grace offered gospell yit assure selues yee haue streyned selues yee dedicate selues god seruice yee doo nothing furtherfoorth woorketh holy spirit according whereuntoo sayeth another place doo woorke owne saluationphil b euen though could doo somwhat selues yit addeth must bee feare trembling say putting away presumption knowing behoueth v depend vppon another addeth reason god sayeth giueth abilitie performe owne free goodnesse manner must wee indeuer selues yit must wee therfore conceyue vayne ouerweening meane whyle though shift able owne syde doo neuer little without god grace saynt paule exhorteth v rather feare warenesse seeing wee bee weake may bee also starke dead good rotten caryons caces saluation haue much one good thought owne seeing say wee haue god hand2 cor b must bee fayne woorke power holy spirite let v learne walke humilitie moreouer let v ceasse make grace auaylable assuring selues woorking power shalbe alwayes wyse prayse must euer redound alone drop remayne ouer selues yee see wee haue remember vppon speeche saynt paule sayeth newe man created yea verily therin sheweth wee bee falne originall state whertoo wee aduaunced god grace person forefather adam sayd adam fall vntoo v spirituall death wherby wee bee cut cast awaye number god creature without cause dooth god oft vtter dreadfull sayingcene b repenteth euer made man therin detesteth corruption sin v god hath humane passion shewe v vtterly mislyketh v vntill image bee renewed vsgene sayd god looked vppon made exceeding good faultlesse father adam falne made himselfe straunger fountayne life stripped stark naked goodnesse beyng separated god could vtterly forlorne past hope recouerie shall wee fynd eyther lyfe ryghtuousnesse holinesse soundnesse vpryghtnesse god yee see adam cut aray creature woorthie bee reckened euen among frogges vermine earth brag wee much wee list nature wee beare greater curse god lyce flea woormes earth cause paule sheweth v god cannot acknowledge v child vntyll image bee repayred v thing doone newe creationiohn c lyke adam drew v downe plundged v gulfe death wee created new agein god person lord iesus christ cause doth name himselfe resurrection lyfe wee must ryze agein wee wyll liue deede thing cannot bee except wee haue first bin deade declared large morning therefore wee ought haue reason alwayes v wee weene selues bee rightuous make lyfe allowable god bee euer fully resolued perswaded god wyll take nothing good woorth handes knoweth bee owne sayd without nothing euill meane image defaced v adam sinne therefore standeth v hand bee made new ageyne iesus christ sheweth v may bee doone saying ryghtuousnesse holinesse woorde rightuousnesse meaneth soundnesse vprightnesse liue neyghbours without deceyt without malice harme dooing yeelding euery man soundnesse reigneth v shal wee shew deedes fashioned agein god image ryghtuousnesse ynough men haue ryght except god also haue purpose v bee theeues towardes men yit traytrous towardes god absteyne stealing away neighbour good meane whyle rob god honor therfore must ryghtuousnesse matched holynesse twoo table lawe inseparable vnder woord holynesse paule comprehendeth thing belong seruing god newnesse lyfe therfore namely walke purely god eschew corruption vncleannesse separate selues defylementes world offer selues sacrifyzce vntoo god syde walke soundly vprightly neighbour performance two thing requisite perfection christian life certein god lawe hath taught v halues wee haue god hath shewed v right rule wherunto may bee nothing added aught taken two poynts rightuousnesse conteyned namely god bee honored feare reuerence handes serue one another without doyng harme agein forasmuch men inclyned pitiously feyning euer thinke ynough set faire countenance vpon matter therfore dooth paule adde truth sayd wee may take holyest folk world yit neuerthelesse condemued god clenzed hypocrisie god may bee witnesse iudge wee bee dubble mynded haue bumbasting v go right meaning simplicitie although hand cleere theft extortion thing ageinst charitie haue lust lurking within v surely shal bee still vncleane god without cause therfore doth paul adde word truth notwithstanding comprehended whole perfection lyfe two former poyntes bycause would alwayes content god gay outward showe according vanitie leazing wherwith wee fraught therefore behoued bee added lyke god spirit must wee also bee faythfull trew abhorreth dubblenesse hart scripture termeth har hart wee fall making partition keepe backshoppe behynde euer commeth v must needes bee filthie corrupt springing euyll infected fountayne wee desire haue harte allowed god fountayne must first bee scoured truth must reigne v nowe wee see effect wheretoo behoueth v apply indeuer long wee lyue heere beneath boast selues bee christian consider condition iesus christ head hath knit v vntoo hym turnyng thinges vpsyde downe hath bin sayde morning looke manner one wee couet bee counted esteemed among men must wee bee god angel therefore wee must fyght ageinst owne vyces vntyll owne nature bee doone away bee doone one day wee must go towardes continewally let v assure selues lord iesus christ giuen v patterne example moreouer office reforme v spitit god father wee may walke newnesse lyfe become god creature euer wee haue drawen corruption adam sin may bee quyte clenzed away therwithall let v consider also pith thing god alloweth rule good lyfe namely first honour serue god afterward walke neyghbourly one another indeuering doo good haue neede v absteyning dooing manner euyll harme doctrine easie ynough conceyue wee vtterly peruerted wicked affection soothly man great doctor preaching vntoo men yit cleere apparantly knowen thing man apply owne vse yit shall bee excuce v wee shall fayne come account great iudge wherefore let v beare doctrine well mynd yea let v gyue good heede seeyng yll put vre whole world among papistes talking ynough god seruice liuing holily yit world seeth wretched soules stand buzzing sort pelting tryfles uerlaboring themselues bee neuer forewarder rather god cause euen euery man owne head deuizeth rule owne liking meane whyle god speaking familiarly without darkenesse heard men doo rather giue themselues thing cannot auayle v although wee haue lyght gospell say superstition papistrie trifle yit wee neuerthelesse farre doctrine sift lyues trew holinesse ryghtuousnesse gospell men take like tread god truth vnder feete oft li bee short yee shall fynd brag reformation adayes vnholy vncleane people yea part euen dogges barke ageinst god despyze truth rayle woord vnlesse let ip bycause thinke nother heere holynesse number would bee counted adayes great christian pillers churche insomuch would make themselues greater god could yea although bee woormes woormes meate yit ceasse blaspheme farre cast foorth thunderboltes madnesse say men shall speake haue else wyll conquer god touching sayd rightuousnesse shall man fynde euery man sayes nothing deceyt nothing craft nothing forswearing extortion outrage violence euery man complaynes neyghbours neyghbours howsoeuer cace stand see rightuousnesse good banished world therefore inasmuch name iesus christ gospel shamefully vnhalowed abuse falsely wee haue much neede remember paule sayth heere namely god disclayme v vntyll beare mark bee created new agein iesus christ bee truthfull haue sayd already though wee esteemed angel yit shall hypocrisie bee alwayes lothely god wee bee clenzed indeuer trew ryght meaning affection imploy selues seruing god helping neyghbours heeruppon deuydeth doctrine intoo seuerall poynts applying particular exhortation first sayeth euery man must leaue lying speake truthe neyghbours bycause wee bee member one bodie without cause doth saint paule heere lay foorth thing particularly erst spoken generally wee would alwayes shift hand doctrine myght vanish away aire come v god speaking v generall myght suffyze v wee teachable wee ought bee receyue instruction hand bycause bee snarled vanity god doo say generally wee must bee reformed according image vtterly renounce selues toucheth v wee let passe therfore fayne decyfer parce meale hee make anatomie thought affection bring lyght vyces wee would fayne hoord vp huthther muther thing saint paule goeth sayd behoueth v bee reformed image god lord iesus christ new man head wheruntoo wee must lyke fashyoned gone doctrine bin receyued without geynsaying meane whyle man fared better lyuely instruction hee speake whoredome theft deceytfulnesse drunkennesse hatred hartburning suttle flyghts passe betweene neyghbour neyghbour thing thus layd foorth particular men wakened although euery man shrink back inuent excuces deuyze shift yit wil nyl must need feele hartbytings v order saint paule keepeth wherfore let v make well ynough v haue bin taught dewtie one woord glaunce god neede warne v shewe v flatly well vyces wherto subiect inclyned owne nature also vyces whertoo diuel draweth v temptation wyles short god must fayne guyde hand feete eye eares mouthes must bee fayne make v see wee may ouershoote selues sort sort end wee may bee well armed syds diuell fynd gap open bee able make breache intoo v wee haue beare mynd intent wee take selues able folk hearing matter ynough v wee shall woonder see diuell neuerthelesse ouerreache v many wayes therfore let v bee well ware wee giue good eare warning giuen v bycause whit needeth forasmuch saint paule spoken truthe sayeth put away lying speake euery man truthe setteth woord truthe another sense heere hee afore calling holinesse ryghtuousnesse truthefull ment ought bee glozing disguyzing ryght meaning simplicitie god looketh witnesse intoo hart may fynde dubble dealing v maner word truth taken afore speaketh truthe ought reigne among v wee traffik bargaine one another must bee faythfull trustie businesse dooings must vse wyles deceyt yit ynough wee must mark truth wherof saint paule speaketh playn dealyng wee lay open hart neede requyre wise go get men good v suttletie craftinesse profit selues another man losse contrary part vnder word lying comprehendeth lye made speache man sayeth whyte blacke example one aske man pryce thing would sell crowne woorth shilling saint paule speaketh lye grosse farre square euen lyttle child able condemne name lying meaneth manner counterfetting cousining short pollicies shiftes men haue wherein glory looke world termeth wisedome policie dooth saint paule call flat lying man counted bee wittie adayes except filche deceyue meane bywayes couert coueyances shal perceyue ge woorse picking chest breaking sunder yron woorke get away money murthering man theefe commes naked swoord cut poore wayfarer throte therefore politike murtherers needes counted honest men may disguyze themselues much list hypocrisie yit called heere deceyuers theeues murtherers appeere men god seeth deeper wee doo iudge dooings bee deede shall men gayne excuzing themselues nothing wee marke geere well shall see speaking lye paule condemneth thing men make account suttletie wittinesse skill behaue man selfe companie world sayes man must hold hare hunt hound must beware hee bee ouerraught must alwayes preuent rather preuented fashion world euery man stand vppon gard haue nettes ready intrap men intangle hundred time ere bee aware saint paule sayth wee must vse soundnesse playne dealing wee must speake truthe one another bringeth v backe another purpose namely wee bee one body let v come owne member one hand play legierdemayne conuey thing self hurt foote conspyre ageinst legge bellye could woorke pretie slyght ageinst stomacke thing wee bee member lord iesus christ separating selues bodie wee vse fyne shiftes pretie slyghtes notwithstanding condemnable afore men doubt wee protest ynough mouthes wee bee christian whatsoeuer wee pretend iesus christ bee misfashyoned fancie lyke one haue v one bodie yea euen conditio euery v serue neyghbours cannot bee doone except counterfetting ee first put away wee see hand dooth yeeld self simply seruice rest body lykewyse foote euery member dooth dewtie anye one bee daunger rest sinke asyde imploy themselues succour among profer deceyt cling toogither according order nature euen ought wee proue selues bee member iesus christ lyke playne dealing saint paule applyeth particular exhortation thing spoken generall namely wee bee clenzed hipocrisie fayning god wee shew whole lyfe wee haue doo one another wee vse guyle walke playnly one poynt therof springeth another wee must prouoke anger one another wee see man moue v little wee bee chafe passios excessiue nother reason measure v men caryed away doo forget themselues nothing wey vse perswasion yee therfore saint paule sayeth quiet one another wee cannot bee knit intoo bodie lord iesus christ besydes much lyeth v deface god image v giuing head passion chafe fashyon bee hot one ageinst another seeme al lykelyhod ment take common saying drawen fourth psalme alledgeth psalme report naturall sense apply owne purpose wee may well take many textes scripture apply dyuers thing howbeeit without altering thing yit notwithstanding shall abyde naturall sense styll euen end paules saying myght bee better receyued sayeth bee angrie sin though bin common saying well knowen bin taken almost prouerb dauid vseth woord signifyeth properly chafe storme howbeeit rebuking persecuted wrongfully bycause hardned theyr malyce forepossessed great venemous rage ageinst made conscience oppresse forasmuch therfore sawe wilful stubbornnesse enemyes sayeth vntoo bee yee angrie yee shal sin whereby dooth v wit cause caryed away rage ageinst nother feare god honestie conscience could hold backe become wyld beastes cause sayeth bee angrie say enter little intoo questioning reasoning selues examin yee bee dooing yeee sin euery go intoo chamber bethinke aduyzedly yee shal perceyue hithertoo yee haue bin driuen diuelish rage doctrine ryght necessarie men bycause wee see headinesse v insomuch wee haue sooner conceyued toy head without inquyring god without asking counsell mouth prophet esay exhorteth v doo wee take thing wee haue conceyuedesay good needes subdewe men lyking therefore cause wee ouershoote selues much wee enter intoo examination matter selues wee myght discerne betweene good euill euen yeelding god due authoritie giuing eare reuerence modestie thing sheweth v woord haue wee neede bee angrie say bee greeued selues complayne selues wee sooth selues wee haue bin woont doo wee doo wee shall sin say great malapartnesse deeply rooted v soone bee abated wee shall abhorre fyght ageinst god affection get aforehande v god set foote ageinst say nowe yee make warre ageinst mee vnawares heeruppon saint paule sayeth bee yee angry sin say frendes maketh storme one ageinst another neuer little fault bee committed ageinst yee bee streyte chafe would rend vp heauen earth bee reuenged offence yit meane season yee haue matter ynough bee offended euery one neuer go owne person seeke cause anger many wayes offend god euery day yee ceasse prouoke early late yit one touche tip finger yee pelting chafe cause therof seemeth yee haue conspyred satan tormente selues beare selues hand yee shall bee well quiet yee haue reuenged wrong hath bin doone vntoo cursed quietnesse men rest reuenged vppon haue offended way asswage wicked heates euery man thinke shall surely haue ynough wherfore bee greeued bee angrie bee reuenged himself2 cor c according wheruntoo saint paule second corinthian declaring trew repentance alledgeth sorinesse wee conceyue vppon knowing sinnes saying said sorines bringeth greef suffereth v quiet rest maketh v fall stomaking ageinst selues consideration terriblenesse god wrath wee haue prouoked ageinst v yit notwithstanding suffereth v ceasse bee still good hope resting vppon god goodnesse mercie therfore one bee come poynt bee angrie themselues knowe haue sinned seeke bee reuenged enemyes rather redie doo good doo pray good exercyze euery man ought spend battell surelye bee good holye passion man anger proceedeth zeale godward loue beareth towards wee doo say euery v bee greeued owne vyces certeinly wee shall neuer fynd leysure emnity folkes spyte neyghbours wee haue trew zeale god honour vndoubtedly wee forget offence committed ageinst v bee hastie say mayntayne myne honour honestie wee shall haue another greater woorthyer let hold v backe wit reuenging fault wee selues haue committed ageinst god whereby hath bin dishonored much v lay forgetting offence hath bin committed ageinst selues thus yee see effect wee haue consider vppon saint paule sheweth v men must turne eye away occasion may conceyue bee reuenged others fly doo come ouerthwart eye wee bee spytefull choler much needeth make v fall euery body doth thing mislyketh v let v learne forsake selues thinke euery v vppon owne faultes wee may bee displeased may rid away cholericknesse wherethrough wee fall fyghting ageinst god make v bee angry great number vyces whertoo wee bee much giuen thyng wee haue remember first place touching second poynt wee delay vntill next sunday tyme shall god leaue bee discoursed length let v fall downe maiest e good god acknowledgment sinnes praying make v perceyue therwithall inlyghten v doctrine gospell wee may espye owne sinnes shamefulnesse bee ashamed selues also behold ryghtuousnesse hath bin shewed v lord iesus christ tend thereuntoo indeuer bee fashyoned therafter wee may come dayly neerer neerer theruntoo vntill wee cleaue throughly vntoo meane tyme beare infirmity graunting v grace amend day day hope shewe mercifull toowardes v wee play iudges ageinst owne selues condemning vyces wee perceyue v maye please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c xxxi sermon eleuenth vppon fourth chapter bee angrie sin let sunne go dovvne vppon anger nother giue yee place diuell let stole steale let rather labour woorking vvith handes thing good may haue giue vntoo needeth wee saw last soday euery v looked well owne vyces wee shoud haue ynough wherwith stay chafing choler wreaking wrath vppon offend v wee bee wayward selues alredy small thing put v pacience therfore fault another man committes ageinst v neuer little alwayes set v chafe bycause wee take much leyzure looke vppon men faultes meane whyle forget owne remedy set v downe heere keepe v soone lyghly offended men faultes euery v enter intoo vexe chafe see wretched v saint paule hath shewed much better behoof bee bee greeued owne vyces euery small occasion men behaue themselues lyking addeth theruntoo let sunne go downe vppon anger must vnderstand paul ment acquite soone angrie soone appeazed vice worthy blame although bee excuzable feeding displeazure turneth rancour hatred yit notwithstanding cannot bee soone pacifyed wee shall haue offended god alredye choler wee heare sayd euen mouth lord iesus christmath namely wee shewe signe displeazure grunting betweene teeth wee bee alreadye daunger hel fyre god wee shal neede haue giuen blowe haue doone open wrong wherby wee myght bee brought iustice wee haue offended farre haue conceyued pritch excuce v therfore saint paule forbiddeth v feede anger dooth vtterly iustifye gentle easye bee reconcyled soone forgiue bee blame woorthie alredie sayd afore proceedeth degree say freends euery v thought vppon owne sinnes certeyne wee bee moued mislyke selues bycause wee prouoke god wrath ageinst v hath lyuely feeling owne fault arme therwith ageinst wee ought haue zele godward though wee attourneyes zele ought procure v condemne euill whersoeuer wee fynd anger alwayes elbowe yea dwelleth v wee shall neuer bee perfect bee wisshed long wee bee world yit notwithstanding howsoeuer cace stand let v beware wee suffer selues bee possessed inordinate passion wee conceyue hartburning go bed vppon surely wee shalbee poysoned mischeef wil bee espyded easly one man felt self alredye attached infection disease linger miserie meanes possible eschewe phisicion runne farre backe possibly coulde woulde offer come afterward would haue remedie late bycause disease settled hath ouergrowen phisick cannot stand stead euen man angrie contineweth without purging malice stomacke certeinly man inward vnespyed disease groweth strong afterward becommeth vncurable second degree saint paule hath set downe heere first sheweth v wee may bee faultlesse god respect anger choler wit thinking euery v vppon owne fault condemne bee orie feele anguishe mynd wee bee men half holy anger one god allow th yit notwithstanding forasmuch wee bee ouerweake wee commit fault leastwyse let v dubble though wee haue offended god let make v multiply choler ageinst least diuell get possession v wee cannot afterward abyde bee brought backe agein intoo good way passion doo ouermayster v make v followe without end measure wyse let v beware also cause sayeth wee giue place diuell sunne goeth downe vppon anger trew wee haue sooner tripped diuell hath alredy power ouer v howbeeit brydled wyse wee bethink v fault amend god suffereth hold v captiue prisoner farre ouerseene take pritch lyke wel owne testinesse therupon conceyue number fancy rancle inward say wee bee poynt wee haue giuen satan entrance hath taken possession v afterward tyme v wish returne mischeef rooted deepe growen strong medicine doo good haue shewed alredy see paules meaning therfore let v put doctrin vre first poynt wherof examin well euill v may angry selues euery v foe driuen zeale godward hate abhorre owne vyces let first thing bestowe studie vppon shall haue wherupon occupie well chafing choler shalbe hasty take pritch ageinst haue doone v wrong wee rather beare haue fowly offended v bycause wee shall haue buzinesse ynough serche owne imperfection sayd afore wee shall easlyer beare mennes misdealings wee perceyue selues blame woorthie many wayes towards mortall creature towards liuing god wee wee keepe stirre euery wrong doone v seing wee craue forgiuenesse god hand euery day necessitie also constreyneth v offence wee haue committed ageinst maiestie wherthrough haue broke ryghtuousnes meane therfore appease al wicked excessiue cholericknesse euery v greeued angry self bycause see self subiect many infirmity rather many sinnes vyces seconde poynt wee chaunce stumble fall fraylty wee bee hild backe feare god wee faultie let v beware wee doo harden foade selues euill dooing soone wee feele anye vnmeasurable mouing v let v step indeuer represse let v vse violence behalfe subdew passion carye v away making v skirmish ageinst god neyghbours thus must wee fyght manfully brydle cholleriknesse else excesse haue escaped v let v come back agein bethink selues better let v rid away quickly assuring selues disease requyreth speedie remedie else ouergrowe wyze succour shall come season let v think vppon saint paule sayd thus freends let sunne go downe vppon anger rancour doo settle bee easly put away bin much warning ought haue suffyzed v threate setteth downe sayeth giue place diuel ought make heares stand vp vpon head deede haue expounded bee spoken enemy fayth seeke occasion slaundering easie bee seene woords selues hee intended warne v thing wee ought bee afrayd scare v woorse wit diuell getteth maystrie dominion ouer v wee feede grudge hartburning ageinst brother v wil quake feare heareth subiecton vntoo satan bond lyke prisoner yit take heede thing told v heere paul hath vttered god sentence wee pursue anger hartburning ageinst haue offended v one wee wilfully passed obligation satan bee hild thralles vnder tyrannie much therfyre dooth stand v hand bethink selues aduyzedly vyce cannot througly amended first brunt wee may lestwyze bee well ware doo settle v cannot bee set one agein wee pursue quarells men bee able wey v vntill wee haue taken reuendgment let v take heede say wee enter intoo bondage satan euen cause sayd men doo fret chafe fashion one diuell made wayne god alredy offended neyghbour dooing mee wrong also fal stomaking matter part need requyte lyke diuell hath v bothe ought pitie soule sort stayed away alredye hygh way perdition ought seeke bee one agein salue sore much possible also let reynes looce cast self intoo satan lauerie cursed libertie take getteth vpper hand party let v beare threatening well mynd whereby holy ghost ment waken v throughly euery v myght stand vppon gard beware taking pritch stomacke thinges least afterwarde wee conceyue hatred may harden v shall bee meanes appeaze v hereuntoo paule addeth another warning haue declared already wherein rebuketh common vyces contrarie rule lord giueth v intent wee lyue god child knowing wheretoo wee bee called nowe speaketh deceytes robbery extorsions committed euery man much wedded himselfe hath conscience mennes harmes let stole sayeth steale rather let labour vvith handes doo thing good profitable vvheriwth may succour haue neede wheras paule speaketh heere theft meaneth theeues men punishe whipping hanging manner slyghtes craftes vsed get mennes good euill practyzes extorsions bryberies lyke thing although thing bee faced else giltie bee accuzed men bycause skill cloke misdooings yit dooth paule call theftes robbery prophet apostle spake ordinarie manner speeche vsed courtes iustice earth eye iudgment seate god thing may bee excuzed yea peraduenture well iustifyed men shall fayle bee condemned god seeth much cleerer mortall creature agein fauour parcialitie may beare sway oftentymes lawe matter shal cloking dissembling couering iudges shall lyke well ynough haue napkin tyde afore eye man may haue starting hole scape may oftentymes lyke well ynough thinges god wherefore let v marke well forbydding v steale publishing statute lawe belongeth temperal policie wee bee called heauenly iudge discouereth thing hidden men condemneth wicked couetousnesse theft whereby bee moued seeke owne profit much hinderance neyghbour bee short vnder woorde theft stealing paule comprehendeth wicked practizes vsed deceyue men withall also extorsions whereby men fleeced good bereft substance wee see theeues bee found degree man buzie gryping himselfe meane reformed god spirit although marchant man bee counted good wealth yit haue store fetch policy still shal bee nettes layde simple sort haue experience perceyue lyke cace handicraftes men haue skill counterfet woorkes wyse men shall bee deceyued agein touching pryce trusting al one may sell ware thinke lawfull lykewise doo laborer husbandman bee short state men wherin infinite faultes extorsions bee seene euery man would gayne make himselfe strongest yee looke vppon rich vppon lyue rente yit woorse flea skinnes inferiour people vnable resist yit men sayd doo iustifye themselues howbeeit bycause knowe god hath sounded heere trumpet summon ne consider manner perfection purenesse must bee brought vntoo much therfore dooth stand v hand try onely outward deedes also wicked affection wherby wee tempted inrich selues b yond reason saint paule sayeth purposely hath stolne steale shewe ought appeere chaunge lyfe god hath brought v home gospell wee may resemble wretched vnbeleeuers walke darknesse consider lordes inlyghtening v condition wee become newe creature herewithall wee see thing haue touched alredy namely paule speaketh common theftes condemned punished afore world follow bin theeues bin conuerted christianitie sayde afore vseth woorde steale purposely make v abhorre craftinesse malice suttlenesse catching men good bin sayd thus vse craft deceyue men nother take yee leaue pull thing none owne touched much quicke flatter themselues seeke haue couert cloke vyces withall sayeth steale ende wee thinke thus selues ala albeeit would fayne excuze self seeming doone amisse mee men haue bleared eye yit must rest vppon meane whyle faultes shal fayle bee registred god must bee fayne yeelde account thing haue bin doone according vncorrupte equitie ryght must bee taken theef god notwithstanding world haue quit mee let v see howe well doctrine put vre man shall fynd conuerted gospell take libertie doo euill seeme number haue learned nothing else gospel buzie themselues pretie slyghtes intangle men good bee seene vsed greater simplicitie tyme blynd wretch knew nothing god pure doctrine saluation least wyse vpryghtnesse playne dealing worldward haue profited backeward god schoole bee farre wylyer making theyr owne aduauntage taking libertie bearing themselues hand thinges lawfull therwithall bee shamelesse facing bolstring dooinges doo make pot beare themselues hand haue great wroong doone bee blamed thing apparantly knowen men whereof euen little child may bee iudges much wee bee condemned seeing paule telleth v heere although wee enriched selues crafte extorsion made conscience rake men good v wee good teaching yit leastwyze wee bee well aduyzed walk vpryghtly neyghbors inlyghtened god word yee see thing haue beare mynd vppon text lord iesus christes doctrine ought rule v singlenesse euery v may forbeare craftinesse suttleties furthermore forasmuch number excuse themselues saying shall doo haue trade liue vnlesse may follow still myne owne maner dealing saint paule sayeth let labour let would make excuce hath wherwith fynd self except hee may deceyue defraud let sayeth paule giue self laboring hand sayd men dispensing selues vnder colour fast indure many misery penury tryfling toy god allegation nother heere god sayeth paule bee afrayd shall want let forbeare labour marke one poynt heere let v learne leaue self soothings wherwithall number folkes doo bring themselues asleepe haue sayd shall doo doo beare themselues hand god mouth stopt dare come nygh needes bee priuiledged owne seeming bee quyte cleare alledge themselues whereof shall lyue shall doo follow woonted trade seemeth v god shet gate hath authoritie condemne v wee haue alledged thinges selues folly sayeth paule wee rather scratch vp earth nayles offend god dooyng wrong neyghbours thing wheruntoo sendeth v backe man growen riche hath lyued long tyme ease fil hing stealing say prety fyne slyghtes conueyances ageinst equitie right let bee ashamed abate countenance labour getting liuing albeeit haue erst doone nothing sit stil gotten liuing deuyzing mischeefe yit let bee ashamed labour take paine sustenance bee short saint paule sheweth v heere vnlawfull gaynes must bee left call themselues christian wil bee taken bee warning needfull v adayes euer besydes wee must absteyne suttletie deceyte god calleth v bee child haue v maynteyne brotherhood among selues many v also must giue ouer trade liuing number meanes liue vppon popedome wee come god let v alwayes remember definitiue sentence haue set namely consider cace concerneth answering earthly iudge seeth thing cloking thing therfore let v thinke well vppon seeing many meanes excuzable poperie wherwith good fourth part world maynteyned yit vnauaylable also abhominable god first bee priestes moonkes rabble cloysterers secondly hanger liue waged men haue geyne doo skum part fatte one meane vnder couert lurketh long tayle turned like maze agein great sorte bee seene giue themselues wholly thing nothing woorth trew darkenesse men see well insomuch black yee would say turned intoo whyte yit howsoeuer cace stand placard men behalf euery man must haue eye like hithertoo haue filched polled get liuing haue exercyced wicked practize god condemneth woord seeing defyled eating bread came mee lawfully hand god doo according asking dayly bread filching must hensfoorth chaunge copie learne labour wyse may truly say thing haue doo come mee god blissyng thing wee haue remember vppon lesson saint paules behoueth v put much better vre considering theeuerye ry e adayes world euer yit notwithstanding number men doo flatter themselues still behalf bycause belly needes haue foredeele man hath whereon liue say thing necessary besydes good reason exempt god woorde wee starue hunger order rigour forasmuch wee bee inclyned seeke bee prouided hooke crooke without regarding lawful vnlawfull let v thinke better vpon thing paule telleth v heere proceedeth yit one degree chaunge inioyneth vnto faythful telleth must absteyne defrauding men polling goodes also indeuer succour haue neede although seeme ouer rough vnto v absteyne euill sted liuing ease haue bin woont hauing many commodity wee bee fayne scratch liuing earth nayles say labour greate peyne trauell yea fare verye hardly although say seeme ryght hard yit must wee go whe haue wherwith get liuing without vsing wicked practizes wee must spare somewhat god giueth v blissing releeue needie withall therfore let v looke whertoo wee bee inclyned let v consider owne nature wee bee froward wedded owne profit euery v need bee alwayes well stored forasmuch wee haue little regard mebers bodie lord iesus christ aswel selues must take paine inforce selues good labor bring v another wee must say inforce affection theruppon imploy selues earnestly vnfeynedly wee may bee able protest bread wee eate commeth v god hand wee bee susteyned goodnesse father cantleth euerye child pittance let v bee poynt moreouer let v think ynough absteyne craftinesse wynding men fetch catching men good let v labour doo good little wee haue succour haue neede howbeeit saint paule addeth heere yit one circumstance deserueth wel noted haue v labour thing good addeth hee let v consider number trade craft occupation world serue nothing corruption toll penny say truly men aware bycause men contented haue wherwith bee prodigall intent money may flye abrode agein owne seeming cannot get liuing otherwyse inuenting newe deuyces euery day angle money fooles purse giuen lyghtnesse agein haue wherwith need set themselues bee braue worldward cause occupatons trade serue pompe superfluitie wote nycenesse allurement alonly prouoke folke leaudnesse need make men beleue nothing amisse saint paule hath therfore set downe distinction heere ynough man say oh take peyne haue myne occupation haue trade ynough hee must see whether bee good profitable common welth whether neyghbours may fare better ought end wherto trade occupation state doo tend whertoo ought referre themselues namely euery man looke imploy self thing wherby may doo good cause wee lykened member bodie then1 cor b say hand imploy self delyghting member notwithstanding receyue harme meanes bodie go destructio asmuch must alwayes haue eye calling soeuer wee liue god must go v hee called v wee followe way sheweth v woord surely neuer allow trade occupation beehooffull seruisable whole common welth redownding also profit men therfore man vse trade occupation purpose breede offence bee sotte men delicate delyghts marre vtterly else set pomp excessyuely though men purposed euen despyte nature make hauocke good thing god hath giuen v certeyne thinges without compasse godly vocation calling god dooth vtterly disallow thou mayst well say haue trauelled yea thou hast serued diuell lyke diuell hath martyr hath also seruantes wee see gyuen superstition doo martir themselues without end ceassing yee would say starke mad vpon good wit oftentimes scripture also vseth comparison shew diuell casteth men quite boundes possesseth yee see many men torment themselues without reason yea yit diuels martirs lykewise great number shall haue taken much paine trade occupation get liuing yit man looke purpose serueth shall fynd nothing infection filthinesse serueth nurrish pride superfluitie short open prouoking god wasting misspending thing god hath giue commaundement vse soberly stayedly maruell therfore though paule haue set downe distinction therfore let euery looke diligently himselfe father mynded set theyr child trade occupation let looke common custome may bee gaynefull let match twoo thinges toogither namely haue considered trade sonne may best get liuing prouyde himselfe household commeth bee maryed therwith let also looke serue neyghbours turnes vse craft mysterie may redounde common profyte men thing father must haue respect vntoo setting child trade occupation bee forepossessed wyth regard may gayne howe may alwayes bee hylde order swarue one way lustes carry v away wee sooner spye little gayne wee bee snatching one wee shooke handes satan yea thinges become hayted hooke casteth v lyke hungry fishe soone bee taken foode raught costeth hir full deere fareth intycementes satan men haue forecast thus ho man gayned well trade great profit may bee made steppeth al aduenture neuer make bone scan consider whether bee ryght wrong sayde afore choked euer come consideration much therefore dooth stand v hand marke well saint paule sayeth heere namely men bee desyrous get lyuing must bethinke themselues aduyzedly beare themselues dooyng thing bycause customably doone others fault found among men consider haue doo god wee must make account agein let v haue good eye thing told v heere say succoring needie saint paule intended warne v one woord lord setting poore folkes v intendeth trye wee bee namely whether bee kyndnesse v whether wee bee cruell lyke wyld beastes thing also ought moue v compassion cause scripture speaketh dooing almesse besydes vseth woord mercie sayeth also bowel ought moued see brother neede yee see syght neyghbours necessity ought prouoke v liberalitie releeue let v tary till cry hunger tyll wee bee inforced tyll shame compell v let euery v thinke hath man neede hath god se mee hath made mee knowe ynough euen much summoned mee sent receyuers rentgatherers take vp reuenewes lyke haue reuenewes rente send men demaund gather vp lord requyreth v wee pay tribute say homage money wee owe acknowledgment thing wee possesse come euen meere free gift sendeth v nother shreefes serieantes poore ought suffyze v bee trew receyuers ende looth giue cause necessitie set eye end wee bee touched pitie compassion theruppon bee inclyned doo good let v marke summe thing heere spoken first wee forsake manner trade lyue agreeing god woord assuring selues wee shall alwayes bee taken theeues wee vse wicked trade although wee haue good assurance calling good lawfull yit must wee vse wyse bee rauening craft deceyt marke one poynt agein let v vnderstand excuce v god insomuch although wee alledge famine pouertie necessitie serue acquit v wee must set hand labour wee may earne lyuing lawfully forbeare profit selues mennes losse finally besydes bynding vp handes dooyng man wrong vsing pretie shiftes slyghtes get men good let v haue regard doo good yea let v haue speciall care succour want howbeit bee thinges god hath giuen v owne offering sacrifice wee must make vnto acknowlegment benefytes wee knowe almesdeedes called sacrifyces therfore wee doo wee must protest vnfeyned trew meaning hart wee come doo homage god thing wee hold bee theft hand certaine sacrifyzes shall bee vncleane almesdeedes shall bee turned intoo lothsomnesse let euery man beware doo pill poll one hand giue anone let euery v haue handes cleane nother let v haue dubble hart labour vprightnesse earne lyuing wise god send v profit wee may take free gift good sooth moyses also forbyddeth v father peece gayne vppon owne runningdeut vppon labour handes god haue v bee beholden therefore wee doo almesse let bee protestation onely mouth also hart deede namely according lord hath shewed himselfe liberall vntoo v bestowed vppon v giuen v ouer aboue wherwith serue owne neede wee bee willing doo homage let v shewe deede wee intend keepe selues thing hath giuen v doo put vse whertoo hath ordeyned say releeuing haue neede let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment faultes praying make v feele better wee may bee sory aske forgiuenesse profit feare beyng withdrawen fleshly affection wee may continue feare loue intent profit keeping holy commaundementes let v saye almighty god heauenly father c xxxii sermon twelfth vppon fourth chapter let filthie speeche proceede mouthes onely good edifye neede shall require may giue grace hearer greeue holy spirit god vvherby bee sealed day redemption saint paule correcteth vyce heere daungerous yit notwithstanding common bee among men bycause see first harme bringeth therfore doo take leaue easlyer doo bee sayd hold pleasant talke meane whyle think man harme thing may bee abidden say possible poyson neyghbours mynd yit bee harme hardly may men bee perswaded notwithstanding holy ghoste haue sayd say lyght leaud talk tending giue libertie vntoo euill one talk ministred poyson men soules nowe behoueth v much mark told v heere saint paule termeth filthie leaud talk cannot infect men deny sayd afore experience sheweth sufficiently1 cor without cause sayd another place euill woords corrupt good manner though wee weere neuer modest chaste cleane mynded giuen good yit wee admit wanton talk perceth euen bottom hart wee bee atteynted wee perceyue insomuch marreth v vtterly deede woman giue eare message brought hir tending seduce hir man may well say shee harlot alredie thing self manifest ynough certein vnchaste leaud speech baudie trick although party giuen casting foorth leaud talk doo alwayes mynd yit intent euer doo satan author sayd afore vnchaste looce talk haue full scope need must wee bee poysoned hand mischeef haue course therfore without cause dooth saint paul forewarne v vncleane speeche sayd afore filthie speeche proceede mouth contrarie part setteth downe wee haue sufficient matter talk one another wit edifye men may fare somwhat better communication accordingly euen heathen men say dooeth one good bee man companie shall euer heare good sentence neuer go without carying away good nature moneth say therfore let v learne abhorre shun plaginesse man shall haue tung looce speake woords smell pump men say one shall hold one syde another stead receyuing good man shall feele bee stung satan deede truthe word enter hart ere aware sting sata giueth v secret vnespyed seing sayd man worthie bee heard wee hate rather deadly plague yee see thing haue mark first place lord hath giuen v tung make one another priuy myndes intent make serue benefyte neyghbours therabouts ought wee imploy wholy tung meane vtter hart mynds one another ought guyde residew hauing superioritie ouer thempsal c b syde without cause termed name glorie shewe wherabouts wee ought imploy vse namely honoring god therfore wee looked well vppon order nature ought bee sufficiently printed hart woords bee necessarie furtherance neyghbours welfare profit first poynt therfore wee haue beare mynd lord haue partes v serue dooing good specially tung drift talk bee edify example one hath neede counsell another warning another rebuking another put mynd thing else taught bycause vtterly ignorant agein extendeth thing present lyfe trew principall thing wee haue looke vntoo teache ignorant shewe way saluation besyds man misbehaue selfe bee negligent slothfull must bee spurred foreward good exhortation bee vnruly hee must bee shamed much lyeth v may bring backe tooo seruis god agein man must comfort heauinesse giue counsell distresse intent fall intoo despayre bee short wee must indeuer hold backe poore ules else go destruction others principall benefyte yit wee see poore man lyke bee deceyued wee must giue warning bee come poynt certein wee shall giue selues continually benefyte behoof neyghbours yea euen infinite wayes well respect bodie soule let v see nowe whether wee haue sufficient ground matter woorke thing vppon wee cannot go one step wee see one hath neede bee spurred another bee rebuked third bee comforted another bee taught wee hold toungs care nother bodyes soules linked v wee ought vnited finger hand open dispyzing god wee imbace naturall vse toung wyse therefore let v keepe v marring thing wee ought set much store namely meane wee haue glorify god making confession fayth calling vppon also seruing neyghbours turnes manye sortes haue shewed alredye first poynt wee haue marke streyne lawfull vse whereuntoo god hath ordeyned toungs ought bee applyed wholly thereuntoo wee ought procure furtherance neyghbo r saluation also temporall benefyte welfare thing wee seduce disorder vtterly quenche put away feare god wee serue satan looce talk wee labour deface honestie wee moue men beastly lyfe defyling toungs vtter peruerting order nature let v learne occupy selues good necessarie talke wee eschew defyling selues wicked communicatio baudes trickes satan corrupt well dispozed serue god wee see looke manye looce speech passe worlde many spirituall poysonings sayde afore corrupt good manner although wee cannot made beleeue yit certein proued sufficiently ynough eue experience howbeeit let v bee fooles learne great harme rather let v yeeld told v holy ghost heereuppon wee may gather bee thought straunge though world bee adayes giuen leaudnesse seemeth bee euill vse iesting scoffing talke insomuch men would make vertewe fynd bone lykewyse wee see great number iesters scoffer whose drift put away shame men myght let themselues raundon become vtterly shamelesse wee see much vse therefore maruell though wee gather frutes wicked cursed licentiousnesse much suffered heereby wee see also bee thought wanton baudie song louemakings young mayd vse vsed commonly sing foolish song loue shee bee made whoore euen shee knowe whooredome shee imboldened inhardned vnshamefastnesse diuell getteth possession hir shee knowe chastitie meaneth horrible thing put foorth hirself leaudnesse breake hir fayth troth shee shall haue plyghted shee come mariage mayd bee able discerne shee shalbee vtterly mard aforehand shee acquaynt hirself leaude song wonder mischeef bee redressed whereby appeereth satan laboreth behalf streyneth vttermust knowing hath v great aduauntage may sowe cursed cockle corrupt good manner surely diuell wrought wee myght easly deale dispatch rid away ribawdries filthinesse rememberance deadly plague haue sayd afore impossible though sorer punishment yit wyues maydes leuer go prizon bee taken harlot correct vyce corrupter whole world brydle cursed toungs serue nothing infect thing filthinesse yit notwithstanding wee shall haue lesse excuce warning stop eares wil needes harden harte ageinst holy ghost shalbee driuen yeeld account offending god many wayes also poysoning folkes soules sort thing much heynous horrible murthered body doo poyson beastes shalbee driuen world deserue well shalbee doone slea bodie poysons also make assault vppon soule ceasse corrupt goodnesse feare god yea honestie sayd afore leaude talke yee see thing wee haue remember streyne asmuch god hath appoynted toungs vse wee haue heard wit seruice neyghbours benefyting bodie soule wee must imploy diligently thereuntoo therefore let v aboue thing keepe v infecting inclined serue god thrusting way casting foorth speech may coole goodnesse prouoke euill yea make licentious negligent euill speech corrupteth good manner many wayes naughtipackes bee seene corner god bee warned haue remorse dooings ush say god passeth much agein othersome come extremitie yit lessen faultes shalbee veniall sinnes othersome doo cloke thing others generally say tush wee must bee carefull god haue v liue sadly thing bee lawfull v laugh within whyle speaking manner burie feare god little little yee see manie sortes folke yea many mo needeth doo shew themselues much bee manie recordes leaude woordes poysons murther mennes soules withall therefore let v stand vppon garde behalf first sayd let euery man beware speake chastely vse none honest speeche therewithall let v shun diuels iest matter fashyon notwithstanding mirthes sake bee welcome v sometymes also fare well free coste say wee good fellowe make companie merrye whereas men desyrous haue folke tickle eares casting foorth iestes daliances lyke thing let v learne shet doores wee would willingly hold vp throte dagger wee sawe drawen nother would go seeke one murther body doo wee long sore haue soules murthered much woorse wherefore let v eschew folkes doo nothing quenche put feare god v make v shamelesse hard harted bereeue v honestie shamefastnesse feare least god pay v wage wee deserue hauing acquayntance familiaritie people therefore let v doo indeuer plague may reigne among v bee deceyued sayeth saint paule speaking scoffers1 cor serue prouoke lustes bereeue v remorse conscience abate feare god v abuse v wyze sin may delyght v beware sayeth none bee deceyued lying woordes bycause hath bin common thing age therfore let v put saint paules counsell vre onely let euery v keepe good watch bee surpryzed also let v haue care keepe folkes beeing corrupted fashyon thing wee haue remember heere wee see sayeth namely wee bee weake ynough yea weake yea saped euill horrible see therefore wee couet record still newe lesson leaudnesse quickened spurred vp others drunkard hauing well stuffed filled alredy euen till bee redye burst seeke still prouoke appetyte myght drinke lade wyne newe agein euery man sufficiently giuen euill though leaude song vnthriftie talke diuell fyndeth gap open drawe v naughtinesse flattery harden v pray doo wee giue vpper hand v wholy pleasure may driue v drawe v whither listeth hereuppon paule addeth vvee must greeue spirit god wherwith vvee bee marked sealed ageinst day redemption heere yit one declaration ought touche v neere trew thing haue bin spoken ought well good desert bee throughly mynded thing v peruert order nature applying tunges cleane contrarie god hath appoynted honour benefyte neyghbours agein bee giltie infecting men filthinesse peruerting giuen seruing god prouoking person vntoo beastly vnshamefastnesse shame honestie moue v sufficiently wee tootoo blockish paule telleth v thing ought scare v yit much greeue god spirit sayeth wee bee marked sayeth dwelleth v sealeth hope saluation harte also seede lyfe wee haue warrant v euerlasting saluation certeine wee take libertie doo euill speake euill fyghting ageinst god spirit much v lyeth choking lyght hath kindled v taking brydle teeth doo naughtinesse cannot bee doone griefe thing paule intended say heere howbeeit let v marke first speaketh heere common maner holy scripture wee knowe passion god propertie men bee sorie greeued god vnchaungeable notwithstanding bycause wee conceyue hyghnesse maiestie infinite wee cannot come neere therfore vseth similitude euen rudenesse sake therfore sayd god prouokod wrath moodinesse make v hate euil bycause fyght agenist god transgressing lawe one wee would prouoke anger spytefulnesse scripture meaneth make god subiect chaunge sayth angrie sorie leadeth v owne dooings intent vyces displease v much euen abhorre heere saint paule speaketh god anger also sayth holy ghoste sorie greeued wee bee god child speaketh epistle romanesrom b except holy ghoste dwell v wee woorthie nature bee mustered aray bee fellowes angells wee say rottennesse moreouer cursed adam chyldren wrath howbeeit god holy spirit calleth v inestimable honour dignitie beeing child wee may call vpon father haue familiar resort vntoo himrom c gala therfore doone holy ghoste cause called spirit adoption inheritance heauen belongeth v respect wee bee god child wee bee selues nature told therfore followeth commeth god freebestowed goodnesse hee sealeth vp hart holy ghoste cause sayd wee haue mortall bodie thing ment heerby feete hand skin bone flesh lump corruption v reason dwelling sin v bringeth nothing death haue wee liued tyme wee go away intoo dust cindre man seeth alredye beeseeged hundred death considering disease infirmity wheruntoo wee bee subiect agein age make v stoope perceyue long whyle aforehand summoned come graue seeing wee perceyue number deathes toogither body much greate dungeon soules wee hope god would take v vp intoo kingdome saint paule sayth spirit lyfe bee one grayne one spark spirit lord iesus christ v let v assure selues wee shalbe parttakers glorie sayd raysed agein dead hath gotten vpper hand holy spirit maner wee quickened wayting till wee bee deliuered corruptible nature compasseth v paule sayeth wee bee sealed holy ghost2 cor sayd first chapter heertoofore place besyde second corinthian similitude fit although god promise ought sufficient authority haue ful credit v theselues yit notwithstanding misbeeleef wee cannot giue credit rest vppon till bee confirmed warranted vntoo v wee may say behold euen god speaketh one syde forepossessed distrust syde alwayes doubtfull misgiuing cannot rest vpon thing told v god name reason wherof promise alwayes vnauaylable vntill print hart thing dooeth holie ghost peece euidence made authentical setting seale god warranteth promise saluation hart signing sealing holy spirit cause often sayd god spirit sealeth vp inheritance saluation hart cause also named earnest penny another place2 cor bargain made although bee present payment seene yit earnest penny bee giuen bargayne concluded chapman cannot say afterward tush repent mee bargayne forsake nother say fynde selfe deceyued ouerseene therfore rather keepe ware styll eche bound one make money deliuer ware euen sayd god spirit earnest penny lyfe soules sayd god byndeth vntoo v respect infirmitie whertoo wee bee much inclyned deede oweth v thing wee haue much cause magnifye goodnesse free harted bynd himselfe willingly vntoo v wheras oweth v thing vou safeth assure v bycause seeth v feeble weake lyke hee sweareth owne part needeth adde thing single woord himselfe truth thing commeth must bee doubted myght seeme therefore othe maketh superfluous dooth abuse owne name dooeth bycause seeth v weake wee haue neede bee hild vp many wayes specially bycause seeth v giuen misbeliefe therefore must bee fayne remedie whensoeuer god sweareth therin stoopeth vntoo v pitie wretchednesse sealing ratifying promyses v holy spirit euen bycause impossible wee selues beleeue wee could bee sure thinges promiseth v call vppon ouercome temptation world vnlesse vsed meane therefore wee haue much neede beare text mynd paule sayth holy ghost sealeth harte hereupon wee may gather good lesson humble v withal namely wee shall neuer yeeld god chiefe honour requyreth handes except drawe v giue v grace discharge whithall thing requyreth aboue woord haue authoritie ouer v wee yeeld reuerence may sooner speake wee shall answer amen say may bee ryght full accord betwixt obedience fayth cheef sacrifyze god requyreth contrariwyse part nothing replying ageinst god woord wee bee full lustes although wee seeme make vtter resistance ageinst play mad bedlems many doo yit wee giuen number wicked imagination see insomuch frantike specially man speakes god haue mouth open spew blasphemy enter disputation debate shewing themselues vtterly vnwilling receyue good doctrine othersome fall intoo furie outrage yit let slip whatsoeuer sayd looke come one eare go agein howsoeuer cace stand nother one doo giue glory vntoo god receyuing woord humilitie ought doo therefore let v acknowledge owne naughtinesse bee sorie seeyng wee prouoke god displeasure yeelding honour thinking bee soothfast trew deede wee wil say open speeche word vayne wee accuze leasing deceyt yit dooth protest wee doo much wrong commes wee credit saying long people slaunder mee sayeth rob mee myne honournum b complaynt maketh moyses many place scripture surely saint iohns saying bee trewiohn namely wee beleeue god set seales trew say wee vphold faythfull contrariwyse haue sure groundwoorke fayth god word win much handes make v betake selues wholly vntoo without gaynsaying one wee counted god lyer insomuch although wee would hate abhorre vtter blasphemie yit dooth complaine wee haue doone like reproch without cause therfore wee see frowardnesse nature vntill god remedie furthermore wheras sayeth holy ghoste sealeth promise fashyon hart let v vnderstand bycause hath voutsafed chooze v wee haue seene alredy heertoofore calleth v inlyghteneth v truthe gospell according choozing v wee borne yea making world therfore let v vnderstand god spirit speciall gift bestowed vppon men indifferently reserued treasure child hath chozen cause wee ought beare well mynd foretouched tytle spirit adoption also vnbeleef throughout whole worlderom c giueth euident proof god goodnesse hath pleazed ingraue woord hart certeyne fyght ageinst god bee brute beast carelesse woord dooth whit moue wee see wee bee nature wee bee still lord mercy sake touched v holy spirit yee see wee haue beare mynd wherfore whensoeuer doctrine saluation talked let v beeware wee presume thing vppon owne wit policie let v bee small lowely lord may inlyghten v holie spirit wee perceyue wee haue receyued grace alredy let v burye let v giue prayse deserueth contrarie part sith wee feele many perplexity douts vnquietnesse sometymes bee tossed lyke ship redie topple ouer sunk bottom sea sith perceyue selues bee trubbled let v consider owne fraylty although wee haue bin trayned vp god woord yit bee stedfastnesse hart except god woork theruppon let v runne remedy pray god keepe seede hath sowen v choking assurednesse heritage euer wearing although satan streyne self vttermoste destroy god hath put intoo v yit may bee strengthened v day day needfull v yee see wee haue beare mynd saint paule sayeth wee sealed marked god spirit warneth v heynous cryme greeue yea intollerable trecherie haue told alredy similitude intendeth impute excessiue passio god spirit put v shame make heare stand vp vpon head behold sayeth saint paule god spirit hath chozen dwelling place vs1 cor cor according sayd another place soules also bodyes temple holy ghoste glad bee v abyde make continuall home nowe wee fall spyting though wee mynded chace banish v diuelish dealing yit notwithstanding wee seeke allurement vnthriftinesse wee take leaue corrupt selues leaud loose talk wee labour haue naughtie meanes turne v awaye feare god bring conscience asleepe one wee indeuered set purpose chace away banish god spirit v say wee haue acquayntance must wee need moste miserable cursed creature wee ouershoote selues farre thyng paule eye vnto therefore whensoeuer wee bee tempted vntoo euill diuell laboreth make v take pleasure remorse conscience maye bee put away let v call mynd thing spoken heere say thou reioycest wherin seruing satan syde thou lettest go thy lyfe earnestpenny thy saluation foundation felicitie hath bin purchaced deerly thee lord iesus christ let v thinke aduyzedly vpon moreouer certein euery faythfull man ought feele thing declared heere lord haue touched v giuen v sealing spoken heere bee greef vntoo v wee bee tempted vntoo uill thing holdeth v awe spirit watcheth wardeth withstand enemie wee go aboue kill benefyte say inwoorking god giueth v al one wee greeued holy ghost certein experience one sheweth v thing holy ghost hath put intoo v vtterly ageinst euill must needes bee battell stryfe betwixt insomnch none god child sin shall bee stirred vp feare say ala shall become plyght haue brought self shall doo cor c sorrow saint paule speaketh wee must shun wee neuerthelesse go still euill one wee tooke pleasure dryuing chacing away god spirit prophet esay sayeth wee prouoke god spirit bitternesseesay c wee refuze good doctrine setteth afore v paule passeth yit heere deede kynd prouoking god wrath wee yeeld doctrine sure record care hath saluation loue beareth v wee must come considering euery v god hath voutsafed ingraue beleefe gospell hart intent bee sure saluation dooth voutsafing chooze mee house dwell mee holy spirit blot grace asmuch ment estraunge self god wilifully therefore let v beware extemitie let v hold selues awe therewithall let v marke also saint paule addeth last woord god sealing marking v manner holy ghost ageinst day redemption hereby sheweth v wee well ouercome satan allurementes lustes flesh temptation world wee must alwayes mynd heauenly lyfe promysed v wheruntoo wee ought trauell god spirit sayth paule giuen v bee withdrawen v agein wee haue felt grace power intent seale print abyde v euen vntoo day redemption say tyll wee bee delyuered transitorie lyfe misery wherwith wee bee beseeged therfore seeyng god hath giuen v holy spirit guyde gouerne v lyfe death intent wee neuer bee depryued destitute let v looke well may alwayes keepe possession hath taken v wee also inioy inestimable benefite continuing v euer may guide v hold v alwayes vp strong hand duryng course life cause saint paule doth purposely call v backe last day make v lyue soberly knowing like wee haue neede bee guided throughout power god spirit wee bee depriued estraunged hym left destitute grace bee feared wee shall fall intoo reprobate mynd touching day redemption paule woord vnderstoode happinesse wee hope hidden v yit trew wee redeemed person lord iesus christ wee inioy benefyte yit wee may well say iesus christ redeemer say hath deliuered v set v free bondage subiection death sinne wherin wee paying raunsome makyng attonement ye see theniohn c wee bee redeemed respect sonne god hath performed requisite deliuerance saluation hym selfe auoweth mouth wee come selues wee fynde thys redemption cause well thys place eyght romanes saint paule sayth last day wherin iesus christ appeere day saluatio deliueraunce wee see number misery beset v round yea wee carye v bee inclozed bodyes soules behoueth v therfore seeke better state see heererom c cause sayd saluation lyeth hope wee hope thing wee see god intendeth feede hope wheras sheweth thing eye promiseth behoueth v wayt hand end although wee bee forlorne wretch world yit wee ceasse reioyce knowing wee shal bee disappoynted wayting heritage hath purchaced v yee see ment woord redemption set downe heere wherefore let v learne bee armed fenced god spirit fyght ageinst satan temptation may neuer fynde v vnprouided order may bee doone let v pray god ingraue truth v spirit wee may get victorie ouercome ageinst saluation continuing vocation god calleth v may take corage bee pacient vntyll lord iesus christ lyfe doo appeare lyfe full happinesse may also bee manifested comming let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment fault praying take v mercy impute great number sinnes vntoo v whereby wee bee blame woorthy rather beare infirmity clenze v day day wee may growe increace gracious gif e put farre v euill may seduce v thrust v way meane wee may draw neerer neerer vntoo vntyll wee bee fully knit vntoo comming lord iesus christ may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c xxxiii sermon thirteenth vppon fourth chapter first vppon fifth chapter let bitternesse hastinesse wrath roring iniurie bee put spytefulnesse bee yee gentle one another kynd harted forgiuing one another euen god though christ forgaue fifth chapter bee yee therfore folowers god deere child vvalke loue euen christ loued v gaue himselfe v offering sacrifice vnto god sent good sauour wee knowe god child bee peaceable themselues also procure peace vttermost power make attonement whereas disagreement stryfe forasmuch marke lorde iesus christ hath giuen v ought reconcyle betweene secret grudge much ought wee absteyne mouing dedate authoritie meanes shall wee haue bring toogither greeued one another set brotherly attonement asswage choler bee moued ouer vehement passion wee selues bee full stryfe trubble giuen cry roring storming without cause dooth saint paule declare bitternesse vvith testinesse anger cursed speaking ought bee put avvay faythfull euen vvith al spytfulnesse setteth downe spytefulnesse heere roote yeeldeth frutes speaketh woord meaneth churlishnesse maketh euery man bee giuen drawe alone without regard others cannot bee man loueth ouer much must needes disdeyne neyghbours shake gentlenesse bee gotten hand wee intend auoyde stryfe quarelling wee must begin poynt putting away churlishnesse considering god hath linked v toogither indeuer euery man maynteyne peace freendship regard god hath inhonored make child leastwyze created owne image first poynt spytefulnesse springeth bitternesse wee bee wayward easye bee moued reigneth scornfulnesse v thinke world vnderlings folkes nothing respect v wee bee puffed vp pryde cannot bee wee must needes bee bitter bee pacience stirring euery strawe bee mislyking take thing yll part seeke occasion vnquietnesse according wee see great number contented chafing wrong doone themselues although matter touch doo seeme bee set spyes marke bee thing checke deede man speake one word mislykes wil wyse quyeted still fynding fault euery thing howsoeuer world go must needes bee medling haue nothing doo bee froward nature bee quarelling furthest straunger world matter concerne themselues though man labour neuer much please doo thing may content yit euer mislyke somewhat man aske reason none bee found owne cankerde stomacke bycause haue conceyued rancour puffed vp pryde esteeme owne selfwill disdeyne others wee see saint pa le hath shewed v heere trew remedy hold selues awe wee may liue peaceably keepe selues entering intoo quarels braules phisition bid man beware feuer disease also consider wheretoo inclined see thing may bee ageinst thereuppon say vntoo beware thing surely yee cannot fall sicknesse inconuenience take heed self wee would bee heedie ynough keepe order prescribed v health body come soule euery v negligent whereby wee shewe wee make none account saluation bycause consider one syde diuell laboreth seduce v wee syde frayle wee neuer cease giue selues euill except lord haue armed fenced v woord much therefore dooth stand v hand marke order set downe heere liue quietly toogither keepe selues contention stryfe first must bee blynded excessiue loue selues rather indeuer rid away pryde wee may make account neyghbours liue meekely restreyne v bitter testie taking thing ill part hereupon paul telleth v purged within spytefulnesse bitternesse must absteyne hastinesse wrath roring setteth downe suddein heat choler wherthrough men ouershoote themselues ere bee aware afterward fall intoo rage cannot bee stayed cause behoueth v bee mortifyed bee easie alay heate yea euen quenche wee bee inflamed wrath must need bee full thundering wilbee measure anger yee see thing effect wee haue marke forasmuch god child ought liue peace concord must vttermoste power brydle passion yea consider commeth wrath anger namely fyre kindled open warre preclaymed many woords escape man would wish agein finally therof springeth incurable mischeef wee looke well whertoo moodinesse leadeth v rather earyeth v away namely diuell taketh possession v holdeth v stock wee haue nother reason stay selues farre pacience certesse would stand vpon gard giue place diuel hath bin declared afore howbeeit may auoyd stryfe debate let v learne clenze harte bitternesse testinesse bring passe let v learne esteeme well linked vntoo v vntoo also bound thus yee see effect wee ought put text vre forasmuch thing hard bee kept thing dooth greatly hinder v therfore saint paule addeth behoueth v bee myld gentle courteous one another heere setteth downe contrary bitternesse spytefulnesse spake bringeth v backe principle asmuch wee bee men god hath created v owne image inasmuch hath called v beleef gospell therby hath marked v new agein wee behold image ought moue v gentlenesse wherof speaketh therfore let v mark well cannot despyze least without dishonoring god told afore men made image tollerable earthly woorme esteeme self much exalt self farre set lyght maker let v make excuce behalf wee alledge stand v sted sayd seeing god hath inhonored men hyghly giue excellent nature good reason wee yeeld honour reuerence maiestie tread vnder foote representeth self vntoo v agein man consider self well shall see owne nature glasse neyghbours yi greatest personage worlde cannot say bee made otheer stuffe rest adam child seeing cause haue bee proud disdeyne lyke v alyed v kinred cannot worne howbeit yit peculiar reason respect faithfull god hath ingraued image new agein good defaced adam sinne sith let v learne bee gentle courteous one another bee churlish man may haue accesse v yit straunge scornefull separate selues common aray company men thing paule ment gentlenesse courtesie spake hereuppon addeth mercifulnesse let v sayeth haue compassion one another compassion stretcheth farre welspring moueth v gentlenesse wee alwayes graunt myld spirit singular vertue one without wee cannot continew world may bee mainteyned among v onely meane compassion say disposition mynd causeth v thinke wee see despyzed person yit neyghbour say owne fleshe bone yea yit dispyzed nother hath thing bee esteemed yit notwithstanding myseryes may also fal vppon mee wee consider surely harte yirne see man brought great afterdeale respect others whether weake body haue infirmitie mynd greeue v touch v pitie rew cace would bee gentlenesse v compassion put cace bee poore man sore diseased droopeth draggeth winges vppon ground hee bee hild scorne contrariwyse wee vtterly mercilesse lyke wyld beastesphil coloss b surely ought moue bowells scripture teacheth v inclyne v vntoo pitie leastwyse wee dewtie agein bee impediment wit mynd example sillie soule hath much adoo vnderstand one saying among hundred yea able discerne whyte blacke haue compassion letteth myne owne crueltie maketh mee forget common kyndnesse wherby god knitteh v toogither yee see wee haue droppe pitie keepe v reiecting alyed vntoo v also disdeyning cause compassion mercie wee shall fayle bee gentle courteous towardes neyghbours caces tymes bee short lyke myseries god knoweth bee v moue bee mercifull towardes v myseries neyghbours ought spurres prick v prouoke v pitifull vntoo yea yit euen vyces inflame v choler anger ought minister occasion vntoo v pitie neyghbours see man hath doone mee wrong diuell hath dryuen therunto wretched man dooth vndoo prouoketh god ageinst mee common nature wheruntoo god hath knit v ought bee sorie hart see soule beguyled satan go destruction yi verily therefore let none wrong carie v away doone vntoo v nother let v bee farre prouoked pitie doo amisse namely bycause bee blynded satan prouoke god wrath fight ageinst owne saluation behold remedy wee haue hold v vntoo keepephil colos b bee gentle wee must bee pitifull haue compassion shewed foresayd textes none v would gladly borne withall without could tell lyue one day world perfectest man hath yit infirmitie insomuch men deale altoogither rigorously bee disdeyned yea good vtterly disgraced defaced nay man found hath many infirmity would fayne bee greatly borne withall neede requireth men shake though haue vyces deserue withdrawing themselues wee woulde fayne bee borne withall selues ought wee also pitie others soothly wee see man hath blemishe ought wee thinke subiect verily haue sifted thing throughly shall fynde thing selfe deserue iustly bee condemned yit would fayne bee borne withall though neuer much conuicted therfore lyke wee would men pardon v let v learne pitie men bee angel wee bee thing paule ment bring v thereuppon concludeth vvee forgiue one another compassion go alwayes afore surely wee let pinnes poynt go without examination rigorous sifting without vnmeasurable displeasure experience sheweth deede much therfore body stirre strawe wee would bee pacience bycause pitie v wee bee touched mercy surely wee easly forgiue let many thing slip passe vnseene moreouer wee wil bee yghtly moued bee brydle hold v backe wee refuze admit alwayes freendship haue offended therefore order saint paule keepeth bring v charitie maynteyne v whole summe lesson bee god child say must loue one another knit toogither good agreement peace may bee maynteyned among v possible bee euery man much medded agein myndes farre differing may bee manner condition also differing bee short wee haue infinite cause put v away cut v company surely euery man let himselfe looce charitie shall neuer take place bee banished farre v bee doone wee must first rid away scornfulnesse pryde sayd afore afterward bee clenzed bitternesse frowardnesse wee fall bee cholerike testie euery man brydle subdew owne affection cannot bee doone except wee bee gentle kynd harted namely bycause wee bee creature fashyoned image god knit togither vnseperable bond yit would suffize vntyll wee haue learned knowe owne infirmity euery v bee angrie bycause seeth hath neede bee quickned vp bee many vyces sort neyghbours therefore wee haue neede bond hold v fast togither bee doone wee bee mercifull pitifull common courtesie ought moue v succour necessitie ought also bee force reconcyle vsluke c lord iesus exhorteth v bee merciful intent wee releeue hungry thirsty meat drinke help vp man agein falne decay wee succour euery man according owne abilitie party neede lord iesus intendeth alone trew thing comprehended therein haue v specially shewe mercie forgiuing faultes committed bee extreme shake vtterly altoogither bee commended wee spye many vyces deede wee ought flatter one another trew freendship beare bycause would bee foading v owne destruction man bee freend another suffer ouer come meate drinke end killeth sayd flattering manner foading foolish appetytes freendship wee see poore man poynt throw headlong intoo destruction wee doo well shew selues bee rather traytors freendes wee indeuer plucke backe compassion therefore whereuntoo lord iesus exhorteth v rocking v asleep infirmity flatterie holding selues measure tempering rigour wyse oyle may alwayes bee mingled vineger say effett thing whertoo saint paule ment bring v although euery man doo best bee pitiful may shew ouer greate rigour towards neyghbours yit contrarie nature thing bee haue sayd alredye selfloue dooth blynd v wee make least scape world bee heynous sinnes offence vnpardonable meanes wherof man anger v seeming fault ought wyse bee forgiuen mercifulnesse shall neuer bee found men vnlesse fyght vttermost ageinst owne affection single teaching wil boote behalf wee haue churlishnesse deeply rooted hart wee bee told dewtie dooth half moue v cause saint paule setteth god example afore v heere hath forgiuen v sonne immediatly therunto addeth lord iesus christe spared self redemption saluation thing breake hardnesse v thing mortifye excessiue passion thing reclayme crueltie pull downe pryde loftinesse sweeten bitternesse haue eye god behauing himselfe towardes vsiohn b nowe hath loued world well hath giuen sonne death sake compare selues god distance betwixt v greatest wrong wee possibly imagin bee doone vntoo v nothing comparison least fault wee commit ageinst god man cannot deuyze break god neuer little incountering souerein dominion violating maiestie ouerthrowing ryghtuousnesse thinges precious bee abuzed lyke thing bee found man bee sayd one haue misuzed v ought bee esteemed man infringed god ryghtuousnesse wee haue iust cause condemne selues vntill wee serue god wee ought doo dooeth wee bee enemyes aforehand euen moothers womb wee growe age growe wee continually without ceassing naughtinesse sinfulnesse vnryghtuousnesse yit god hath forborne looke mercifully vppon v insomuch wretched hath vttered infinite mercie sending v sonne wee consider ought pryde bee layd downe bitternesse asswaged rebelliousenesse tamed spytefulnesse rid hart vntruthe put away yi verily cause wee bee wayward heate hath caryed v away wee ceasse euen spurre foreward selues wee doo easly enter intoo contention stryfe house bee must ring v cause hereof euen owne vnthankfulnesse wee think vppon god incomprehensible goodnesse towards v hath spared sonne notwithstanding wee deadlie enemyes notwithstanding wee warre notwithstanding wee cursed alredy nature bycause corruption v yit notwithstanding sayd afore vnpossible wee taste god mercie except wee bee touched compassion haue hart rid cleane cursed affection reuendge albeeit saint paule haue exhorted v thing hard yea vtterly repugnant man nature cannot bee brought passe except god woork behalf yit notwithstanding declaration shewed v heere ought preuayle much v make v forget wrong admit another man haue offended mee try self ryghtuo giltlesse shall come god ala many iniquity transgression mee bee confounded hundred thousand tymes one fault committed ageinst mee bee vnpardonable shall hundred yea whole million haue committed ageinst god bee nothing comparison souerein maiestie following warning paules whensoeuer wee bee moued impaciencie displeasure wrong haue desire reuenge let v learne let v learne say gather wittes aboute v consider wee bee first man haue committed fault ageinst v wee selues doo lyke farre woorse syde let v consider god hath redeemed v yea specially precious pledge blud shed onely sonne haue deserued agein cause hath moued god bee mercifull towardes v nothing else wretchednesse seeing good beyng nature hath notwithstanding compassion wretchednesse wherin wee plundged shall wee doo ought wee haue much compassion one another bycause wee fynd thing selues wee pardon neyghbours god fynd infirmity himselfe howe shall bee moued forgiue v truely euen bycause welspring goodnesse mercy see thing greeueth mee neyghbour examin well selfe shall fynd lyke else much thing perswade mee compassion forgat selfe much way make v easly forgiue many faultes beare many vyces may mislyke v neyghbours cast eye vppon inestimable loue god hath borne v person sonne heereuppon wee may conclude sayde afore wee vnthankefull would bee another manner myldnesse among v wee would soone fall euery wrong doone v ought wee thinke early late day nyght vppon fauour graunted v lord iesus christ daysunne inlyghten v wee brutish consider maketh spirituall lyght shyne vppon v purpose guyde v saluation doone god mercy agein wee behold fauour god sheweth v maynteyning v present lyfe wee woorthie found cost commeth v lord iesus christ therefore would become v sleeping waking eating drinking rest labour thing else consider alwayes mercy god vseth towardes v beare mynd make continewall exercyze specially must grace come alwayes eye wee pray vntoo god accesse may wee haue talke familiarly discharge care greefes intoo lap yea call father wee bee called free bestowed goodnesse lord iesus christ forgiue v transgression wee bethinke v thing wee bee dulheadded brutish heereby appeereth full well shall alwayes bee disallowed bragging selues bee god child household folke faythfull child wee bee willing glad forgiue wee may well boast afore men yea wee may bee estimation fond opinion yit god disgrade v wee bee loth forgiue vnthankefulnesse bewrayeth self therein wee consider infinite goodnesse god sheweth lord iesus christ thing effect whertoo paule intendeth bring v addeth vvee must bee follovvers god vvell beloued child man myght yit reply trew god mercy ought rauish v amaze v woonderfull thing affection ought bee fastened vppon wee able bee lyke vntoo god fountayne goodnesse wee bee leaud vntoward yea god hath full perfection goodnesse much one drop nature maruell though come nothing neere ne haue resemblance lykenes vnto reply say myght men haue made paule added saying bee yee follovvers god say follow yee let bee example patterne although god souerein goodnesse
