wee shall bee able say offended vnwares god forecasting ynough rule whole lyfe leastwyse wee herken sayth yeeld selues easy willing bee taught bee may wee surely bee wyse saint paule requyreth deede expoundeth self saying must vnwyze wel aduyzed vnderstanding wil god sheweth maner wisdome meaneth world speaketh world sayth wyse whe suttleheaded deceyue skill keepe self fro enemyes maynteyn shifting pollicie else wisdome world also lay wel aforehand man profit whether hooke crooke talk feare god talk equitie much lesse single playne dealing bycause wil bee wyze worldward must beare two face one hood must bee malicious must ful lying walketh truth shalbe counted terell make self ayt euery man pray vpon turne nother ryght hand left shall lykewyse bee called idiot yee see wisdome world cannot bee without leaudnesse psal b euill conscience paul following saying scripture namely beginning wisdom feare godprou c feare god perfection also telleth v wee bee skilfull god wee wyze intent vnder woords condemne craft cautells suttleties men vse wherin welter themselues wherof boast shewe stuffe lothsonmesse god manner wisedome shall bee v ynough wee knowe god yea meane whyle shall wee behaue selues towards world god blisse simplicitie wee shal fall intoo are wicked heare lord iesus willeth disciple bee simple douesmath b sillie bird soone scared away yit neuerthelesse bee wyze serpent god therfore suffer v bee fleeced eaten vp wicked though wee liue simply playnly aud haue none worldly shift resist let v etake selues keeping god hee giue v wisdome ynough howbeeit cheef matter haue skill maynteyne selues world disappoynt men dooing v wrong iniurie wee st begin hygher wit ruling lyfe wyse god may allow wee shewe selues knowe hath set v world end hath created rede med v namely wee come inheritance heauen way v bee ryghtly wyze agein although doctrine seeme straunge plundged world vtterly heathenish without knowing whertoo bee called yit notwithstanding wee looke throughly intoo wee shall see vniustly saydpsal b prou c wisdome feare god doo need auaunce themselues couetousnesse ambition trad certein manifestly prouoke god wrath ageinst themselues oftentymes receyue reward deserue spin ha tar themselues child insomuch wheras h ed inriche themselues mayntayne themselues great leaue euerlasting rememberance themselues house heere god dooth curse attempt hoord vp hygher clyme horrible fall confuzion good heaped vp turned vndooing leastwyse worldward put cace prosperitie hild alwayes one stay yit doo wee knowe happinesse consisteth transitorie lyfe continuance shadowe vanisheth hand shall thinke man created god image redeemed blud lord iesus christ adopted bee companion angel dooth notwithstanding play beast wilfully forgetting yea euen pryce saluation man created inherit euerlasting lyfe bee contented hauing three foure dayes pleasure heere beneath neuer passeth rest must need satan hath bewitched bereft vnderstanding reason finally made lyke brute beast man sonne forsake father house sustenance prepared runnes oging abrode haue twoo three dayes pleasure whether bee whoredome laudnesse within whyle becomes begger hath morsell breade eate wil world say chyld starck blynd woorse mad let v compare heritage prepared v heauen purchaced deerly v let v see wherin excelleth wicked cursed lust let v see whither men doo cast themselues shrink away god end lyke bee bee gone away welspring lyfe welfare ioy wee setled vnderstanding surely wee would think straunge trew wisdome men liue feare god thing wherin welfare consisteth sayd psalme much therfore dooth stand v hand mark well lesson paule telleth vspsal wee shall euer bee straungers welfare long wee seeke obey god besyds thing afore sayd wee haue also mark sayd afore rule framing lyfe according god commaundement would god allow v lyke well v letvs v rest vppon owne intent nother let euery v bee giuen much stand ne conceyt say seemes good mee must needes lyke well let v beware ouer holdnesse let v offer selues god assuring selues wee cannot doo amisse obeying inasmuch whole wisdome inquyre wee say lord hath hidden thing v behoof knowe protesteth hee shew v way lyfeiohn wee ubborne bow downe head one accord bee subiect woord protested long afore lawedeut notwithstanding dark comparison gospel wee haue full perfect syght therefore let v alledge wee bee rude grosse nother veryest idots worlde thinke scape starting hole saying diuine neuer went schoole god hath stooped wyse v moste least may bee taught familiarly woord replying geynsaying v suffer selues bee guyded gouerned willes c manifest vntoo v protesteth prophet esay haue spoken vntoo secret sayeth haue sayd vayne seeke mee whosoeuer seeketh mee bee hand shewe familiarly whatsoeuer welfare short paule presuppozeth heere sayeth colossianscoloss gospell preached vntoo v wee shall fynde faultlesse wisedome meanes whereof wee shall haue certein way therfore let v beware wee swarue one way trew men shall wel inlyghtened requisite whereupon wyted vpon owne fault negligence agein although many simple soules atteyne knowledge myght leade direct perfectly seruing god according harte desyre yit notwithstanding submit themselues humbly god woorde receyue giue themselues beare reuerence towardes ought doo shall surely haue good loadstarre leade heritage heauen although drag legges bee well aduyzed bee wi ed cause saint paule rebuketh al vnthankfulnesse stubbornnesse gospell preached bee sure god sheweth much trew god make v ye aboue cloudes feede curiositie number desyre would haue speculation fond heare newe thing would euery day chaunge speeche tickle eares withall god followe fancy farre teache v thing behooffull bri ging v vntoo would therfore thing wee haue remember vppon saying paules let man thinke strauge wretched world runne astray euery man peakes away alone nothing confuzion euerywhere wee see example among poore papistes tir themselues measure yit fayle much comming vntoo god go misaduyzed brutish zele passe whit god euery man followes owne fancie excuce themselues vnder pretence good intent meane hath world bin peruerted meane haue thing bin put order meane hath certeintie bin taken away euen bycause sted god ought bee apparant euery man myght ow downe necke receyue yoke layed vppon men haue taken leaue libertie doo thought good themselues forasmuch god hath bin despyzed men haue bin di elishly bold uer weening behaue themselues windge put thing confuzion disorder great yit stil ought make v shudder thinke vppon much therefore dooth stand v hand hold selues soberly awe submitting selues god pure woord wander one way eeing wisedeme con eth therin thing w e remember saint paules setting downe god full rule thing wee cannot frame selues therafter vnlesse wee take leaue ticklish lust al seemeth good owne eye suffer god reigne ouer v haue maystership among v wee nother adde thing pure woord take thing saint paule could well haue sayd singly wee must walke folke well aduyzed addeth also contrary part vvee bee fooles vnvvyze end shew mockerie men say letted folkes haue meanes followe booke myght doo good poore simple soule handicrftes man therfore cut geere paule tell th v although weene themselues bee wyzest fooles yit notwithstanding god remedie suffer themselu bee gouerned woord howbeeit let v marke sayd afore men aduaunce themselues bee proud thinke gouerne themselues ought doo beginning wisedome fooles selues1 cor hath bin shewed first corinthian one syde presumptuousnesse fewe humble themselues wyse styll plucked backe hindered owne opinion syde othersome rechlesse although haue eares dayly beaten god woord yit continue dull styll bee doone much behoueth v marke well warning giuen v heere bee well taught god scoole wee must bring whit owne reason nother must wee thinke owne deuyces good wee must bee fooles selues say boyde owne reason wee must giue place open way god woord wee accept without geynsaying whatsoeuer vttered mouth heereuppon saint paule come backe agein certeine particular speciall exhortation begonne doo first sayth faythfull ought keepe themselues vvell beeing drunken vvith vvyne vvherein disorder say wee must haue stay selues eating drinking vse good thinges god hath ordeyned sustenance take measurable repast make selues lyke brute beastes wee may profit selues well doctrine wee haue marke first end lord hath appoynted foode thing sustenance lawfull vse wyne water bread vittelles uerily feede selues according neede infirmitie susteyne v lyfe doo homage wee hold lyfe maynteyned yeelding thankes fatherly liberalitie secondly keepe selues occup euery man according degree according abilitie giuen thus yee see lawfull v mea e drinke susteyne v wee myght bee blockes timber euery v myght occupye himselfe thinges god hath ordeyned behoofe neyghbour earning owne liuing honestly specially aboue thing acknowledge benefytes god infinite goodnesse best weth vppon v may bee glorifyed thing sayd another place wee see meate drinke ought serue leade v godcolos c reason god shall haue reached hand powre vppon v benefytes wee receyue notwithstanding go vnknowen wee still cram selues heere cost yit forget leaud detestable beastlinesse therefore although meate drinke bee helpes feeblenesse yit ought wee referre vntoo god deede seemeth first syght wee bee letted hindered doo good well eating drinking also sleeping trew therby god sheweth wee bee syde wee must come also recompence forasmuch tyme sort lost whyle wee take repaste bycause wee cannot apply selues seruing neyghbours tyme forslowing behalfe may spurre v resort vntoo god considering goodnesse towardes v according proof setteth eye thus yee see sayd although eating drinking doo hinder v worldward yit ought syde gyue v occasion bee cheerefull seeking god let v see excesse woorketh man cram full becommeth vnweeldie chaunge nature one defyance god nature order haue sayd already meate drinke ordeyned strengthen v wee may apply selues thing god commaundeth vocation requyreth therfore man pampered first hath defyled sustenance god gaue secondly chaungeth himselfe intoo beast much defaceth image god moreouer god forgotten vnkyndnesse monstruous though man would mingle heauen earth toogither yit saint paule addeth heere vpshot enormitie sayeth drunkennesse royot loocenesse say men oue shoote themselues putting away shame forgetting honestie becomming wyld beastes wee see one property drunkennesse driue men eyther intoo whoredome intoo leaudnesse cast sound sleepe perceyue nothing let man mocke let spit face feele nothing agein whatsoeuer commes toungs ende go bee ryght wrong soone blaspheme god speake vnius ly men discretion men thus caryed away wheras god printed image make reasonable creature giuen excellent state aboue lyuing wyghtes fall playing beastes fashyon become lyke ass dogges must need vnderstoode drunkennesse one detestablest thing bee saint paule ment shewe v heere one word although trew feare god v restreyne v wee well aduyzed discrete consider trew lawfull vse venefytes god hath graunted v yit wee refrayne shame world forasmuch wee see drunken man confuzi n order nothing seen lump lea dnesse insomuch god image defaced reason que ched thing put order therfore sith wee see drunkennesse matched extremity ought abhorre although paule haue giuen heere short glaunce enormicies happen drunkennesse yit wee must consider hath also generall comprehended rest thing wee haue remember vppon streyne wee must bee sober haue stay selues eating drinking although bee abundance v yit wee must bee discrete taking repaste meates drinkes doo comber v heathen men sawe knowledge cannot bee wyped wee must eate drinke li e liue eate drinke agein must take paste strengthen v make v able doo make v vnweldie certein bread wy e meates ordeyned cast men downe forasmuch men else decaye faminepsal b lord reneweth giueth strength according saying psalme wyne gladdeth man hart bread strengtheneth yee see wee haue remember first place seco dly let v consider god suffereth men ouershoote theselues al leaudnesse vtterly without stay theselues without honestie without shame euery man see brute beast themselues perceyue nothing cast vp randon al shamefulnesse ryghtfull punishment layd vppon god abuzing liberalitie gl tting themselues without measure lo heere payment vnhallowing god benefyts deserueth wee cannot vse according ordinance according rule hath set woord imprinted hart though wee neuer heard one woord nother lawe gospell yit wee sufficiently euen beholding order nature heathen men considered heere wee haue remember mischeef dubbled men step asyde giue ouer themselues euill euill degree therfore much lesse ought serue lessen fault wee see number would haue doo cannot deny haue done amisse fall shift last refug saying yee may see ouertaken wyne wit intoxicate drunk behold pray yee howe cannot start asyde one way would fayne haue drunkennesse serue acquit god little stand v stead contrariwyse wee shalbee much giltie deede lawes well ordeyned drunken man haue dubble punishment commit ed offence vnsobernesse woorthy punishment alredy vnhalowing benfyts god dedicate vse myght moue v resort vnto wheras gaue witnesse fa herly goodnesse partie zed fashion trayterousnesse drunkard deserue one punishment agein asmuch bee drawen euill dooing farre though confederated themselues satan ought bee punished agein need excuze cloke themselues although lawes men haue alwayes consideration men obserue ought bee obserued yit notwithstanding giue ouer themselues sort let themselues looce intoo leaudnesse vnsobernesse shall bee driuen answer afore god defyling thing god sanctifyed seruis wherin put mark goodnesse intent drawe v vntoo bee peruerted eating drinking must wee yeeld account god abuzing benefyts bestowed vppon v contrarie intent though wee mynded prouoke wilfully anger seeing drunkennesse make men beastly forget themselues wyse god image defaced become lyke doggs swyne ass sith wee see selues disfigured say yea woorthie bee reiected god horrible monster wee doo also lay open owne shame aud dishonestie men ought euery v atleastwyse bethink aduyzedly brydle lust sort god giueth v meate drink wee fall intoo excesse yi ee see effect wee haue remember vppon streyne wee cannot perfect equisyte let v sygh fault wyse beware wee play beast eating drinking god may bee honored v ought bee dooing homage lyfe also taking continuall occasion meates bee prouoked resort vntoo let v vnderstand giueth v euen taste loue end wayting full inioyment therof wee may learne forsake world serue willinger mynd knowing mayster hath al superioritie dominion ouer v also father desyrous win v godnesse let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment fault praying make v feele wee may truly repent v alwayes resort vntoo ask forgiuenesse name lord iesus christ beare v vntil haue drawen v quyte cleane away corruption world flesh wee bee reformed wee may seeke nothing meanes come perfect ryghtuousnesse wheruntoo exhorteth v let v say almyghtie god heauenly father xxxviii sermon sixth vppon fifth chapter bee drunken vvith vvine wherin loocenesse bee yee filled spirit talking among psalmes praysinges spirituall song singing making melodie hart lord giuing thankes alvvayes god father thing name lord iesus christ beyng subiect one another feare god wee ha e seene morning god offended men abuze benefytes would haue applyed end sheweth word therfore exce e drunkennesse ought bee shunned faythfull bycause knowe god sheweth father toowardes nurrishing world howbeeit shal bee come heauenly heritage hauing leastwyse tast goodnesse continualy confirmed hope giuen lord iesus christ sted beeing drawen vpward men become brutish looze reason mahood vtter peruerting order nature defying god owne ben fytes yit drunkenesse draweth long tayle men flush foorth lea dnesse bee past shame yit shamefulnesse may make folke loth abhorre mischefe increaced much therefore intent kepe v sobrietie orderly conuersation saint paule sayth wee must keepe selues ouercome vanquished wyne contrarie part addeth vvee must rather filled vvith spirit burst themselues eating drinking keepe measure tyll doo well shewe haue feeling kingdome god ne neuer tasted heauenly lyfe remedie therefore ryght conuenient correct excess superfluity reigne among heathenish men neuer conceyued incling god grace spirituall benefytes lyke man emptie deuoure swallow vp al without chawing rather ouerlaying stomack taking sustenance repast therefore another man sawe vyce would restreyne euen haue inordinate lustes token bee emptie wherof fayth feare god ioy holy ghost know whit god goodnesse fauour toowardes grace sheweth v lord iesus christ bellyes full vittelles surely would play wolues rauening wee would keepe mea ure cause saint paule sayth wee must bee filled holy ghost say despyzers god haue none religion lyue ease heere haue delyghtes pleasure excessiuely full beyond reason measure defyling god benefytes despizing order nature sayd afore yee bee sharpe set knowe god profit woord come wayes deuoure doo haue eaten meate twoo dayes afore bee afrayd eating much foode neuer burst soules therefore let v hardily cram selues giftes god spirit ghostly benefytes wherby feedeth v hope heauenly lyfe dooing wee cannot doo amisse wee cannot giue head lustes taking foode bodie followe euill offence matter wee haue effect remember vppon streyne glut themselues fashyon cannot satisfie themselues playing beastes shewe well haue much one drop fayth feare god religion bellye ouerruleth bee subiect thereuntoo peculiar principall idoll seeing let v learne long foode soules forasmuch liberally offered v day day insomuch god whole desyre wee haue suffyzeth saluation let v sharpen appetytes take repast shall wee bee sure meates shall allure v gluttonie wee shall become vnsatiable gulfes wee shalbee contented hauing meete v sufficient necessitie leastwyse behoof furthermore similitude saint paule vseth must bee thought straunge sayth wee must drinke fill god inordinate lustespsal b wee cannot fynd harte seeke principall meaning similitude paule vseth heere forasmuch doctrine yll put vre euerywhere ought thinke better consider great emptinesse professe christianitie shall fynde scarsly say three woordes yeeld confession fayth harte surely mouthes would vtter according sayingrom b wee beleeue hart vntoo ryghtuousnesse confesse mouth vntoo saluation howbeeit wee bee desyrous bee filled wee neede bee counselled go seeke thing wee neede wee neede onely receyue foode profered v set afore v yea serueth well vpbrayd v leaudnesse wee voutsafe go vntoo god though call v make account offereth v wee forget eate drinke refresshing bodyes yit content v nother wee could fynd harte cobble vp yee would say whole world yit notwithstanding euen soberest willing haue ordinarie repaste sort doo cram meate drinke foure fyue tymes day meane whyle wretched soules hungrie still therefore wee must beare mynd warning saint paule gyueth v heere telleth v bee sober well ruled vse measurably benefites god bestoweth vppon v soule must bee forgotten wee must feede vppon spirituall giftes leade v heauenly lyfe maynteyne v hope therof vntyll full possession banish talk may edifye common pelting tryfles moue laughter say saint paule perceyuing vyce ouer common world sheweth v heere remedie wit wee talke one another song hymnes say men myght heare prayses cor saying come let v eate drinke maner prophet esay speaketh forasmuch ryotters haue well stuffed themselues would vyce raunge abrode euerywhere saint paule sayeth contrarie part wee haue taken deale part portion neyghbours according owne measure nowe vppeneth heere song psalmes hymnes differ nothing one another therefore neede buzie selfe setting foorth curious distinction commeth end myrth surely flat mockerie although men allow v yit dooth god refuze paying coyne say folly thing nothing notwithstanding wee shall haue bin zelous praysing god well bee iudge witnesse wee lay open hart must wee also doo ur dewtie towards neyghbours euery man may incoraged tolled foreward example heere wee see first little account made god adayes countenance men make singing prayses howling yelling one grossest abuse papistrie think god ought hold self well apayd haue barked parchment say dooing holy scripture vnhalowed torne peeces yea vtterly falsifyed howsoeuer cace stand nother aduyzednesse ceassing much bound beholden good kynd harted father addeth yit vvee must thanke god thing whereby dooth v wit men blockish consider many wayes god allureth spurreth notwithstanding slothfulnesse say freendes considering much wee bee bound vntoo god respect bodyes respect soules wee comprehend possible wee haue small narrowe wit wee haue sort comprehended god benefytes yit haue wee tung expresse nothing neere much wee bee bound vntoo long wee bee cold soone wee haue spoken one woord wee thinke ynough bee discharged till another tyme returne agein slowely may bee whereof commeth slacknesse euen shetting eye although god shewe v meanes becommeth v bee occupyed blissing holy name yit wee see one whit agein touching bodie beare selues hand good come v eyther owne cunning good fortune fauour world god alwayes let alone goodnesse wee thinke wee intend doo de tie yeelding god dew prayse cheef sacrifyze requyreth sayd afore let v haue regard con der better wee beepsal b c state wee bee subiect many necessity god must bee fayne succour v finite wayes wee haue considered wretchednesse bodie soule contrarie part also considered god prouydeth suffereth v haue penurie without rel ef hand surely wee shall haue wherwith continue praysing holy name without ceassing saint paule haue v onely thanke god benefites wee feele apparantly also although afflict v handle v diuerse tymes otherwyse wee would yit haue v prayse styll example iobiob wee see onely thanked god child table made merry feasting one another also bereft issew left desolate house good taken away partly robber partly lyghtening fell heauen miserable seemed lyce eate vp ceassed say lord hath giuen lord hath taken away blissed bee name lord saint paule sheweth v euen sorowes wee receyue chastizements rough philippiansphil petition requestes must bee matched thanksgiuing shewe wee doo paciently abyde bee gouerned hand god likewise text sayeth wee must thanke god thing wee bee prosperitie thing fall wee would wish god giueth v harte desyre wee lyue delyght pleasure onely fit tyme season yeeld praise vntoo god although squoorge v yit must wee acknowledge procureth saluation welfare meane let v see wee haue cause blisse god aduersities yi first whatsoeuer betyde v beareth v insomuch touche v one finger good earnest wee bee ouerwhelmed first blowe seeyng wee hold token spareth v haue wee cause thanke agein turneth chastizings benefyte purgeth v meanes v continually therby kingdome heauen lift v vp bycause wee bee much tyed world end wee bee gathered toogither come full perfection prepared v heauen wee see haue wee cause prayse god notwithstanding wee bee full greefe care feare doubtes yi certeinly owne vnthankfulnesse hindereth much behoueth v marke well thing paule telleth v heere namely wee haue cause praise god without end ceassing mouth bee stopped sometymes grief wee seeme bee barred praysing god wee cannot apply selues freely theruntoo let v vnderstand god neuer sheweth himselfe rough rigorous towardes v asswageth bitternesse affliction intent drawe v vntoo wee myght thanke glorify forasmuch wee receyue grace meanes lord iesus christ dooth also turne correction welfare wee suffer punishment sinnes therfore sayd vvee yeeld thankes god father namely lord iesus christ setteth downe one syde god father afterward sheweth god father respectes wit meanes mediator reconcyled vnto hath put away al sinnes whatsoeuer thing indure world furtherance saluationrom c sayd epistle roman heere wee haue marke first without fayth wee cannot prayse god ought doo insomuch whatsoeuer prayses wee sing mouth feyning hipocrisie except wee bee throughly perswaded god father marke heere ment fayth papistes suppoze namely beleeue god heauen meane whyle knowe whit saint paule telleth v wee must bee throughly resolued god accepteth v child else wee shall neuer bee able prayse pure free affection may bee doone grounded vppon free adoption wherethrough taketh v lord iesus christes sake inheritance woorthinesse god father wee child ala phe cleane contrariwyse wee bee called child wrath god must needes disclayme v bycause nothing sin wickednesse v ntill wee come lord iesus christ certein wee cannot bee sure god fauour accept eruice therefore saint paule hauing sayd wee must eld thankes v god al thing bycause father dooth iustly adde doone lord iesus christ let v vnderstand afrayd god maiestie cannot trust rest vppon promise fauour call vppon father neuer prayse deede may well vse ceremony shal bee leazing therefore whensoeuer wee wil pray vnto god yeeld prayse thankes fayth must leade way marke one poynt howbeeit sayd afore vnpossible v bee grounded certeintie fayth take god father vntyll wee knowe wee bee made one lord iesus christ forasmuch wee bee member bodie bee also parttakers benefytes hathe purchaced death passion ryghtuousnesse holinesse clenzing defylementes sacrifyze hath offered dooth set v cleere drawe v damnation wherin wee finally hath set v free bondage sin purchaced v full ryghtuousnesse forasmuch wee haue thing lord iesus christ therefore ought wee also geue thankes vntoo god meanes cause papistes cannot frame much one request god alloweth yea deede bee good dumb though man may heare hymnes canticle ynow terme among yit cannot god bee praysed handes although wynd vp thing saying lord iesus christ yit doo beleeue god mercifull nother woorthie bycause disclayme lord iesus christ doo intangle patron aduocates owne forging man cannot discerne others insomuch coope vp corner else set behynd reerward whyle meane tyme hunting merites intercession saintes trust moother diuelish presump ion namely make amendes sinnes redeeme themselues v told v wee must thanke god thing end wee alwayes abace selues cause say fayth openeth v way wel pray vntoo god also giue thankes benefites wee haue receyued hand heerupon saint paule addeth wee must bee subiect one another feare christ feare god bothe fit text wellynough saying wee must bee subiect sheweth lyke god haue child exercyze themselues prayzes also wil haue bee vnprofitable heere beneathe serue one anothers turne inasmuch wee bee able doo god eyther good harme therfore contented wee doo prayse name though imploy abilitie v wherwith inriche god aduauntage giueth v thing needeth nothing self therfore inestimable goodnesse quitteth v wee owe wee protest selues bee greatly beholden bound vntoo wee cannot discharge selues wee come humilitie confesse bond wherin wee stand bound vntoo god payment requyreth v owne part hee seek yit haue v seruisable one another seeke priuate profit wyse forget wee bee knit toogither one mutuall bond charitie thing wheruntoo intendeth bring v text man myght think straunge first blush say wee ought bee subiect one another seemeth meete father bee subiect child husband wyfe magistrate people gouerneth yea euen also bee equal degree bee subiect one another wee looke well vppon thing wee shall fynd saint paule hath without cause put christian vnder subiection magistrats aduaunced authoritie glorie aboue men bound neuerthelesse gouerne bee ordeyned ruler theyr owne saks common welthes sake god ordeyning principality kingdomes state end haue preheminence aboue others behoof haue brydle hold v obedien e vnder lawes haue power authoritie ouer v stand feare awe magistrats bycause wee cannot forbeare remedie seeing god hath set magistrate state certein therfore subiect ought serue reigning ouer much bee sayd father trew father ought bee honored child yit notwithstanding forasmuch honorable tytle shal cost ryght deere gouerne housholds discreetly gouernment also subiection lykewyse betweene husband wyfe subiection husband beareth frayltie wyfe hath discretion forbeare rigour towards hir holding hir companion taking vppon part hir burthen sicknesse helth subiection yi without cause dooth saint paule pronounce heere generally proue themselues faythfull must bee subiect one another namely euery man state degree let hyghly aduaunced consider well god aduauncing end willinglyer submit themselues beare paynes care belong office let inferiours vnderstande ought much rather humble themselues beare yoke layd vppon necke let equal fellowes vnlesse need bee wood beast loth maynteyn c urtisie among consider neuerthelesse euery ought beare neyghbors subiection wee cannot liue one another without forbearing surely al forbearing importeth bo dagerom b therfore must serued necessity sake according wherunto said another place wee must owe nothing charitie byndeth v vntoo heerin wee see statelinesse man shall say owe vntoo trew men may well vpbrayd one another owe dewtie must step yit cause saint paule setteth downe feare lord iesus christ god say wee without god euery man would get alone self wee myght well hold scorne one another say passe thee trewly yit greate intollerable follie say passe thee richest man bee deuyzed dooth notwithstanding stand neede hundred folk helpes yea men help greate ouer statelinesse thrust away neyghbours fashyon vnder colour nother boote v hurt v apparant wee bee blynd dooing put cace wee myght say passe thee owe thee nothing yit must wee come god head put v intoo world linked v togither would haue v serue one another charitie wee knowe none bond perfection charitie charitie bringeth bondnesse although owe man nothing respect self yit doo owe somwhat respect god thing whertoo saint paule bringeth v backe say consider selues yee created put intoo world condition yee serue euery man neyghbours otherwyse yee shrinke asyde one another lyke yee would cut asunder sinewes body intent fall peeces yea lord iesus christ head might haue doo v needes play wyld beastes cannot fynd harte stoope bondnesse neyghbours must go lyue abrode wyld wood bee woorthy lyue among men wee see god hath knit v toogither therby separated v brute beastes yit notwithstanding bound v one another wee wyll need shake yoke playne bewraying thinke selues beholden thing lord iesus christ wee bee loth bee ruled hand submit selues order wherunder hat put v would haue bee kept without breaking forasmuch euery v wedded himselfe wee cannot submit selues one another let v beare mynd saint paule hath set downe v heere sauce make v fynde taste doctrine wit wee feare god fynde harte submit selues quietly wyll must greeue v nother must wee thinke irksome straunge euery v serue bound serue meane maynteyne degree may linke toogither vnder head iesus christ atteyne heauenly glory hath purchaced v let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment faultes praying make v feele may drawe v trew repentance make v profit day day examin myseries wyze wee may bee moued call vppon god remedie may clenze v defend v vntyll haue brought v perfection ryghtuousnesse ought labour wee bee yit farre meane whyle beare v wee may ceasse haue priuiledge calling vppon child also haue wherefore thanke lord iesus christ bycause hath holy spirit sealed adoption harte wherby holdeth v fast wee may perseuer fayth hope wee may euer persist acknowledging manifold benefytes addeth one vppon another learne receyue hand may made holy vntoo v fayth thanksgiuing may please graunt grace onely v also people nation earth c xxxix sermon seuenth vppon fifth chapter vvyues bee subiect husbandes lord husband head vvyfe christ head church lykewise sauiour bodye therefore church subiect vntoo christ also let vvyues bee subiect husband thing yee husbandes loue vvyues christ loued church gaue himselfe sanctify clenzing vvashing vvater vvoord wee haue seene heertoofore euery v subiect neyghbours wee cannot otherwyse lyue one another dooing duetie subiection forasmuch mislyketh v bycause euery v coueteth bee aboue fellowes wee set much store loftinesse hard v stoope wee haue seene also wee feare god wee must thinke straunge wee submit selues neyghbours god created v condition yee see generall charitie doth bynd v one another ought disedeyne man loth man count third man vnworthie haue seruice done vnto respect god wee must eyther bow downe necke else stubbornnesse wil turne decay saint paule passeth sheweth certein degree among men although foresayd rule doo stand generally wit euery v must indeuer performe duetie yit notwithstanding also greater subiection particularly sonne father wyfe hir husband vnderlings superiours indifferently among al men haue told ere brotherood euen betweene furthest straungers earth bycause bee one common nature euery man must needes acknowledge indetted howbeeit god hath knit folkes togither streyter holyer band euery man must looke neerlyer wyfe matched hir husband shee giuen help shee part bodie also speciall subiection although husband bee superiour authoritie yit let also bound wyfe shee companion lyue dye lykewyse child towardes father father towardes child eche one behalfe calling subiects towardes theyr prince superior seruantes towardes maysters yee se thing haue treate must generally liue charitie one another indeuering discharge duetie god byndes v according abilitie therewithal de pyze order god hath set among v rather bee prouoked much doo duetie knowing wee refuze condition wee make warre ageinst god let v come mariage thing ordeyned men wee knowe god author solemnized name scripture sayeth holy couenant therefore dooth call diuine wyfe bee stubborne froward cannot fynd hir hart beare yoke although shee doo wrong hir husband yit dooth shee wrong god bond bee inuiolable behold mortall creature needes breake plucke asunder wee see shee bendeth hirselfe ageinst god syde man needes rule owne lyking fancie despyze wyfe v hir cruelly tyrantly sheweth himselfe despyze god defye openly ought knowe end created state wedlocke lawe god hath set thing therefore saint paule calleth v vntoo state wee haue regard god long eye rest vppon wee bee conuersant surely wee shall alwayes fynd excuces ynow many exempt selues lawe husband may alledge haue spytfull stubborne wyfe else shee proud coy hath wicked head hir owne else talkatiue agein another perhappes drunkard another ydle huzwyfe another leaud disposition short man may haue colour hee keepe faythfulnesse honestie mariage becommeth wyfe also hir part shal bee vnprouyded hir husband may hap bee testie riottous haue small regard wheretoo god hath called ill husbandes hunter tauernes ale house else playe vnthriftes gaming lyght behaueour whoremonger glutton drunkardes euery woman myght pretende excuce exempt hirself hir dewtie wee come god wee must bee fayne cast heades bozom boote v stand checking ageinst although men misbehaue themselues one syde woman yit wil god haue mariage broke dissolued therby sauing diuorce meane lord iesus declareth vyces husband must impeache wyues subiection obedience vnto agein though wyfe bee found bee shee ought bee yit may husband shake hir rid handes hir shift soeuer alledge god ordinance must alwayes stand firme bond wee haue woord must inuiolable thing wee haue remember vppon sentence world seeth ill lesson put vre wee must consider roote mischeef mariage fewe none haue eye vntoo god deede god name shall runne roundly ynough euen wickeddest could fynd hart blisse make prosper marying put themselues intoo hand guyding call vppon vnfeynedly poynt meaning seeke welth gayne othersome pleasure voluptuousnesse lyke cace woman maruell though ende bee order beginning square god must need bee reuenged part lyghtly esteemed despyzed therfore let v learne mark well lesson saint paules lyke mariage ordeyned god enter intoo must betake themselues wholy vntoo make refuge knowing byndeth man wyfe one knitteth toogither therfore eyther looke owne dewtie wheras sayeth concerning wyues owe subiection husband wee haue mark subiection dubble man alredie head woman euen sin fall eue adam3 tim saint paule alledging reason shew meete wyfe reigne equall degree hir husband sayth man came woman woman man shee peece body god could haue created eue earth well adam hee would nay rather matched man woman toogither condition man knowing wyfe bee owne substance flesh bee induced therby loue hir wee shall see agein heereafter wyfe knowing hir elf haue none man beare hir subiection paciently willing mynd hand member bodye shoulde refuze stande owne place woulde needes settle itselfe vppon crowne head thing wee looke backe creation man woman husbande syde ght bee induced loue cherishe wyfe selfe wyfe seeing shee taken substance man ought submit hir selfe quietly vntoo hir head also another bondgene tim dubbleth still subiection wyfe wee knowe shee beguyled woman therfore must remember subiect husband receyue hyre eues sin must consider mariage continued sound vncorrupt bin nothing ioy man wyfe knowe thing blissed god thing shoulde haue turned gladnesse felicitie although god blissings shyne foorth euery bothe aboue beneathe yit alwayes token cursing imprinted wee cannot behold nother heauen earth creature wee may partly perceyue god become straunger v bycause father adam fell noble excellent state wheruntoo created afore bee seene euery thing specially mariage woman ought feele frute sinnes men feele ynough parte surely eue adam continued ryghtuousnesse god giuen whole state earthly lyfe bin paradise mariage bin beautifyed man wyfe matched toogither haue liued accord wee see angel heauen doo among nothing peace brotherly loue eue bin v therfore man hath curst shreud wyfe cannot weeld meanes must consider self lo heere frutes original sin corruption self wyfe also hir side must think good reason receyue payment commeth disobedience towards god hild self awe thus much concerning woord subiection set downe heere saint paule saying lord meaneth make men equall god lord iesus christ greate ouersyght sheweth feare reuerence woman ought beare vntoo god subiection shee oweth hir husband twoo thing cannot bee put asunder lyke exhorted v erst link toogither mutuall subiectionephe added saying feare god wee pretend honour god obey meane whyle reiect despyze neyghbours euery v wedded self need exempted lawe rule grosse hipocrisie also wyfe pretend neuer great deuotion seeme bee throughly seasoned feare god meane whyle bee feend nothing scolding brauling wrangling thinges hir home hir owne house therin shee shewes hir selfe haue one sparke feare god forasmuch shee dooth holde scorne hir husband hir head god lieftenant behalf therfore let v marke saint paule hath set downe similitude match husbandes mortall creature yea woormes earth equall degree iesus christ shewe breefly forasmuch lord iesus hath authoritie ouer mariage men must haue eye vntoo euery person submit himselfe paciently bycause man refuze part without despizing wyll haue wedlocke maynteyned mutuall dewtie man loue wyfe wyfe subiect hir husband pith matter wee haue remember vppon streyne let wyues looke well dewties vnderstand contend husbandes one would reiect god bycause hath created otherwyse condition end bee subiect husbandes trew bee soo proud stately say husband haue head vnder girdle yea wyfe dooth sheweth shee loth god haue authoritie ouer hir would fayne put god lawe vnder hir foote howbeeit forasmuch none shift woman must needes stoope vnderstand ruine confuzion mankynd came syde wee bee forlorne accu sed banished kingdome heauen woman say doo vnderstand came eue womankynd saint paul telleth v another place none way stoope1 tim beare paciently subiection god hath layd vppon nothing else warning keepe themselues lowely myld lyft vp themselues ageinst husbandes cannot fynd theyr harte bee ruled setting seales sinne adam eue disobedience committed declare willing god heale wound agein notwithstanding bee deadly doo make warre ageinst grace god come vtter confuzion wyues leaud headed think yit registred god must bee fayne yeeld account vtter confuzion therefore let v looke wee keepe warning better end euery man may glorify god owne house also let husbandes thinke vppon duety although speake properly subiect wyues bycause wyues haue authoritie ouer yit aduaunced honor superioritie certeyne condition namely bee cruell towardes wyues thinke thing graunted lawfull lift authority rather bee companionship kingship doubtlesse husband wyues head oppresse hir make none account hir let vnderstand authority hath dooth bynd much hir seeing head ought haue discretion skill guyde wyfe houshold way bring passe vse gentlenesse myldnesse beare discreetly frayltie knoweth bee wyfe1 pet b according saint peter exhorteth v yee see husbandes must requyre obedience wyues handes themselues must therwithall doo owne duetie consider shall bee borne god giue wyues cause lifte vp themselues ageinst certein husband deale discretly vpryghtly wyfe shall stoope lord dispoze hir hart house shal bee quietly guyded first cheefe poynt god bee called vppon though man vse meanes bee yit trust owne wit shall loose tyme bycause god laugh presumption scorne husbandes consider god holdeth folkes harte hand boweth listeth thereuppon doo pray giue grace power win wyues may agree humble themselues shall perceyue god woorketh behalfe commonly seene men deale roughly wyues thinke win playing termagauntes sticke brooze body yea somtymes blud followes hangman tormentor martir wyues asd yit notwithstanding alledge superioritie god hath giuen superioritye diuelish nother serueth make men lyke brute beastes maynteyne good order gouernment woman syde doo part inharden themselues rhey marrie neuer thinke vppon thing god sheweth teacheth woord hardly shal man fynd one among hundred prayeth vntoo god shee vppon poynt mariage boubt heare well ynough sayd husband must head themselues say well true haue husband must bee aboue mee fashyon world must abyde meane whyle shalbee ouerweening rather diuelish stoutnesse could fynd harte plucke god seate would fayne matter wee reade razed scripture intent myght bee subiect yea make confederacie among themselues cace saying tush warrant thee hold myne owne husband play churle mee shall well perceyue passe hold bay long see doth looze labour shalbe fayne giue ouer game let mee alone manner say doo woman begin enter intoo huswyfrye man shal scar ly fynd one among hundred mynd dooth fully determine vppon also husband syde think thus tush let mee alone compasse hir well ynough say god hath told v another maner discretion bee vsed behalf way men win wyues step stoutnesse play bedlems vse tyranny ouer none geere boote yit men thinke themselues wyse owne conceyt shall scare wyues grim looke bee short dispute matter meane whyle rob god though reserued nothing self wherby teach v repayre vnto pray meeken hart bow obedience myldnesse therfore behoueth v remember lesson much better shewed v heere cause dooth saint paule apply similitude lord iesus christ well one side telleth woman benefyte bee subiect husband let v consider spirituall state churche miserable state wee separated lord iesus christ bereft hope lyfe god benefyts although wee inioyed many gift world yit turne displeasure wee member lord iesus christ bee short without sonne god nothing scattering heere beneathe sent gather toogither thing scattered subiection husband wheras god hath ordeyned otherwyse yea euen welfare hath declared giuen sentence weene get vpper hand pleading ageinst god yee see iesus christ set downe sauyour bodie end wyues knowe god hath preuyded better necessity bee aware haue well chawed cud debated themselues gathered reason possible bee yit certein knowe well owne profit god dooth hath put subiection husband yea euen owne welfare intent bee maynteyned otherwyse could bee agein syde saint paule alledgeth lord iesus christ husband also intent abuse authority graunted breake frendship ought bee maynteyned wedlocke ouer churlish woont bee thing setteth downe lord iesus christ demaunding hath loued churche first formest hath giuen self spared tooke man flesh vpon deede al power dominion giuen vnto knee must need bowe himphil b saint paule self sayeth v greate small must doo homage yit notwithstanding hath hee doone churche listed reigne sort exercyze tyrannie ouer v contrarily humbled self wheras souerein dominion ouer angel heauen became subiect lawgala called seruant yea vtterly emptyed sake wee see god beareth v inestimable loue lord iesus christphil hath put himselfe person husband voutsafed wee bee wyfe vntoo say wee see woormes earth thing nothing refuze follow example sonne god regard heauenly glory maiestie end abace himselfe wyse sake ynough meeken harte one partie beastly leaudnesse rather stark diuelishnesse wel husband wyues considering lord iesus christ dyd abace himselfe loue bare vnto v carions nothing woorth also hath told v nothing better wyues bee subiect husbandes husbandes beare wyues moue signe bee beastly hygh mynded rather nother wit reason one drop surely thing saint paul telleth v ought make v amend thing myght hinder dewties well one syde well regarded doubtlesse men shoulde see much quietnesse house doo man wyfe bee cattes dogges snatching byting one another mischeefe man see feare god among ought men call mynd euening morning grace shewed vntoo v comming lord iesus christ toogither well thought set myndes maryed men ought also thinke particularly themselues end hath god shewed himselfe louing kynd pitifull towardes mee seeyng hath aduaunced mee dignitie good reason fashion selfe lyke vntoo haue mee behaue selfe towardes wyfe iesus christ hath behaued himselfe towardes mee ynough breake harte hard stone yea steele yi surely likewise woman syde myndfull redemption saluation hard harte needes bee softened would harden themsel e stubbornnesse doo would submit themselues yoke lord iesus christ myght bee parttakers benefyte hath purchaced death passion wee see grace lord iesus christ preached v indifferently men gayne nothing forsake lyfe way wee haue marke although husbandes bee froward wyues vntoward bee ruled yea vtterly vncorrigible yit release eyther doo duetie example may bee husband gentle tractable wyfe touched afore syde could beare hir bee maruelous good lyking lyfe betwixt peraduenture one man say hath drunkard glutton another wyfe giuen garishnesse ouer much brauery shee rap rend little trim hir decke hir withall another wyfe ydle huzwyfe doo nothing well thing may haue colour men yea sayd afore matter concerned party themselues euery myght haue defence hand cast yoke husband must thinke cace haue ill dispozed woman sot one hath nother manner good behaueour care hir houshold doo also behaue selfe worldly affayres also towardes god husband shall haue bethought himselfe well examined owne faultes throughly hold peace paciently beare wyfes faultes vntyll god giue grace amend meane whyle howsoeuer world go let ceasse play good husband applying himselfe wyfe win hir vntoo god set degree superioritie benefyte welfare yoke fellowe forasmuch inuiolable law reason also must perswade woman insomuch woman haue drunkard haunter tauernes tippling house gamester spendall vnthrift ryotter churle neuer quyet shee obey please shee neuer haue peace good wyll hand let hir consider ala god squoorge vppon mee haue bin ought bee obeying god submitting selfe wyll haue applyed selfe serue honour haue quitte selfe charge hath committed mee let wyfe thinke vppon thing let hir conclude howsoeuer shee fare yit mortall creature breake bond wherin god haue v bound stryuing ageinst therfore must submit selfe head although bee terrible yit becommeth mee bee subiect god hath husbandes hart hand alter listeth must prouoke win mee stroke cudgell dooyng god would bee discontented mee faultes wyfe cannot discharge husband keeping lawe vnbroken god hath ordeyned wit lyuing toogither one accord lykewise vyces husband shall excuze wyfe yeelding subiection obedience thing god behalfe sayd heere saint paule confirme exhortation better declareth lord iesus christ sauyour body namely bycause gaue himselfe church sanctifie make holy deede whole doctrine hereof cannot bee dispatched yit notwi hstanding wee haue marke heere paule sheweth large thing one woord afore husband wyfe may brydle wicked affection bee tempted go fall one another meane wicked passion haue eye pledge spirituall vnion betweene lord iesus christ v whereof wee speake fully hereafter heere first sayd must consider lord iesus christ gaue himselfe v wherein beginneth redemption therefore wee must marke word end yit tarying tyll dinner dispatch rest vnder woord shewed v first lord iesus christ sort myndlesse himselfe regarded owne person went saluation trew giuen v godiohn b sayd third saint iohn dyd loue world well spared onely sonne gaue death sake yit notwithstanding lord iesus christ also gyue himselfiohn man taketh lyfe mee sayth lay downe requisite sacrifyzce offered remission sinnes bee willing yee see iesus christ gaue himselfe death wee de aund cause surely first fulfill euerlasting dete ination god father neuerthelesse lyke god father inte ded saluation mankynd iesus christ shewed deere wee precious soules syght sith voutsafed giue himselfe fashyon one syde husbandes must consider well heere owe wyues wit bee eere owne lyues least though doo yit shall come perfection lord iesus christ followe great way behynde wyues also syde must beare well mynd forasmuch god ill wedlocke bee figure grace lord iesus christ bee farre submit themselues god calleth way let v knowe also saint paule ment magnify god goodnesse towardes v loue iesus christ beareth v saying h gaue v therefore let v acknowledge came free mercie god father also lord iesus christ respected nothing misery shewed himselfe pitifull succour v wee mynd thing one syde wee shal bee moued dewtie without geynsaying othersyde inflamed glorify god acknowledge mouthes also whole lyfe much wee bee beholden seeyng hath powred treasure mercy vppon v much hath onely discharged v condemnation wherin drawen v death also hath voutsafed giue v welbeeloued sonne pledge loue iesus christ hath taken vppon office bee borrowe raunsome v end set v cleere god diuel also myght haue ageinst v notwithstanding bee aduersary bee subiect vnto tyll set free bondage meanes sayd redeemer let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment faultes praying make v knowe wee may aske forgiuenesse reforme selues amending matter glorifying infinite goodnesse god wee haue wee consider meanes hathe drawen v death taken v child notwithstanding wee cursed afore adam saint paule setteth foorth wee bee made parttakers grace purchaced v lord iesus christ namely wafshed clenzed spottes end bee dedicated seruice holynesse also addeth wasshing water bycause baptim visible figure record vntoo v according rudenesse infirmitie make v better perceyue grace god passeth vnderstanding man first al woord sanctify importeth bee separated world bee knit vntoo sonne god doctrine wee neuer knowe ynough haue sayd afore wee must alwayes compare state wherein god fyndeth v state wheretoo calleth v moothers womb wee nothing vtter wretchednesse wee bee cursed detestabl fore god therefore draweth v dungeon death thence dooth gather v vp himselfe woord sanctifie paule meaneth chaunge ought rauish astonish v oft wee consider wee wee bee styll god pitied v let v come meane spake sayeth lord iesus christ hath washed v dout bee referred death passion could wee appeere god countenance vpryght sinnes done away sacrifyze offered set v one god vntill wee bee wasshed scoured cleane blud lord iesus christ wee bee fowler god leapar wee bee full maner filth infection bee short wee bring shall prouoke god wrath vertewes men esteeme greatest shalbee lothsomnesse therfore wee must imbrace sacrifyce wherby lord iesus christ hath reconcyled v god father blud must flowe downe vppon soules clenze v filthinesse spot neuerthelesse without cause saint paule set v downe baptim heere wee bee made cleane nother meaning turne v asyde death passion lord iesus christ forasmuch wee bee dust grosse vnderstand spirituall benefyts well requisyte therfore saint paule conforming self rudenesse infirmitie hath shewed v wasshing visible signe wee may better profit selues maner speeche let v consider end baptim ordeyned whertoo serueth lord iesus christ commaunded v bee baptyzed name ment turne away fayth bludshed ment baptim take roome death passion performe office saluatio surely baptim incum appendant death passion lord iesus christ direct v thither certeynely tryfling ceremony much bee fayd lord supper wee c bread wyne pledge body blu lord iesus christ although supper wee bee truly fed meate drink wherof mention sixth saint iohn wit lord iesus chri maketh v partaker truthe owne substance end lyfe bee common vntoo v yit notwithstanding supper bee separated death passion lord iesus christ thing nothing deede wee see also promis conteyneth bodie sayeth giuen trew sheweth well ordinarie foode therwithall sendeth v also death passion made satisfaction sinnes shed blud wash away spot boote v haue baptim supper ministred giuen vntoo v wee see vse baptim well according institution sonne god must set nd vppon corruptible transitorie element water stand one day corru pt clenze soules euer get v purenesse shall continew death though wee selues doo turne rottennesse power cannot bee water wee must necessitie repayre death passion lord iesus christ dede water also figure blud holy spirit let v mark lord iesus wash v shed blud wherby clenzed v meane wherby wee may resort vntoo god full trust wee shalbee recey ed ryghtuous perfect bycause layeth sinnes charge mark one poynt saint peter sayeth first epistle wee hed blud lord iesus christ holy ghost wee see wee haue substance truthe saluation person sonne god moreouer wee haue note also communicateth self vntoo v therby putteth v possession fruition good power holy ghost happeneth saint paule hath made mention heere blud clenzeth v woorking holy ghost seemeth hee hath forgotten cheef thing buzieth self thing small haue told alredye ment abridge thing belonged sonne god wee seeke whole fulnes saluation alone settle fayth alonly vppon nother ment dispossesse holy ghost office respect infirmitie cause set downe signe wherby thing self hygh farre hidden vnderstanding set eye pi h thing haue beare mynd declaration wee may receyue profitable lesson generall wit trew lawfull vse sacrament leade v directly lord iesus christ otherwyse wee make idol therfore poperie baptim charme bycause think saluation water let passe thing haue pu owne deuyzing haue corrupted mard institution iesus christ mingling baptim superstition knowen let v put cace vsed nothing else pure water yit diuelish opinion baptim able self saue v meanes lord iesus christ good thrust away make none account stand poring vppon visible signe yee would say vtterly doted vppon lyke cace rest ceremony much therefore dooth stand v hand beare lesson mynd apply sacrament ryght vse vse god alloweth ordeyneth must guyde v lord iesus christ lyke baptim wee see water therby must lifted vp hygher blud sonne god assuring selues water maketh v cleane warrant washing gotten v lord iesus christ crucifyed v supper wee haue bread wyne hold selues set eye withdrawing selues iesus christ fayth therfore must bee lifted vp conueyed partes saluation inclozed forasmuch wee haue whole perfection fulnesse good thing onely sonne god thither wee must looke vp labour atteyne sacramentes set afore v office else wee pe uert yee would saye vnhallowing thing god hath halowed benefyte lord iesus christ bee separated visible signes wee haue also note wee communicate iesus christ grace holy ghost yit notwithstanding let v hold scorne helpes lord hath ordeyned v bycause knewe bee requisite infirmity sake taught simply wee runne lord iesus christ wee shall fynde washing clenzing seemeth ought suffyze v water baptim vayle keepe v comming vntoo iesus christ yea let v see little owne udenesse wee myndes angel wee neede outward baptim angel forasmuch wee bee earthly hard v atteyne vntoo god secretes heauenly kingdome behoofe bee helped fashion wonderfull gracious goodnesse god stoopeth infirmitie supplyeth mee e conuenient remedyes little dooth baptim hinder v comming sonne god wee bee able apply behoofe keepe fayth amyng without wee bee hild downe still heere wauer continually floting water wee see water cast vppon chyldes head ought mynd blud lord iesus christ consider lyke water washeth away filth body blud lord iesus christ clenzing soules touching inwoorking holy ghost wee knowe lykened water bycause maketh v parttakers benefytes purchaced v lord iesus christ agein bycause grace woorking wee bee renewed dye vntoo world owne corruption put away intent wee come newnesse lyfe gotten v esurrection lord iesus christ must wee behold baptim lykewyse supper must serue v ladder clymb vp lord iesus christ bee throughly confirmed dwelleth v wee bee made one quickeneth v braunches tree take strength roote body man draweth strength head thing wee haue marke vppon streyne sacramentes doo turne v away trust wee ought put wholly lord iesus christ make v start asyde one way perswaded iesus christ suffizeth wee fynd contentation rest end also honour belongeth bee yeelded vntoo v abridge heauenlye father hath giuen let serue one poynt also cause saint paule sayeth hauing clenzed yeeldeth dignitie clenzing v lord iesus christ true bin appoynted bee mediator could haue doone woorke altoogither belonging god forasmuch sent end office committed vntoo therfore wee washed deede humane nature wee bee washed blud wee must also beare mynd apostle epistle hebrewesheb sayth suffered spirit spirit say death must bee considered v man dyed wee must vnderstand wyse sonne god manifested flesh hath vttered euerlasting power abaced emptyed although appeered nothing cursednesse death yit ought wee vnderstand wrought behalfe woonderfull power surmounteth vnderstanding wee conceyue yee see saint paule hath well confirmed thing told wit fayth wauering vanishing opinion vntyll bee grounded lord iesus christ rest wholly nother swarue stagger one way soone wee go adde one thing lord iesus christ surely shaketh v vnworthie haue part portion benefytes therefore wee must leaue owne wit onely clenzeth v according also mere grace wee haue ryghtuousnesse god saint paules speaking baptim sayd afore end wee considering owne abilitie bend selues confirming fayth meanes behooffull v reiecteth baptim superfluous dooth well bewray knoweth self insomuch wee haue well examined v certein euen perfecte shal fynd themselues inclyned vnbeleef many doutings ye would maruell shall see themselues feeble weake subiect infinite temptation must need bee man much blinded pryde thinketh baptim sted considering therfore neede wee haue god certein degree let v make account baptim holy supper let alwayes bee meanes guyde v iesus christ agein without cause saint paule matcheth woord washing water toogither haue touched afore bee drawen away visible thing sted vp aloft wee bee hild downe belowe common vyce deeply rooted v hard bee plucked bee gift otherwyse sacramentes bee matched woord man shall see seale howbeeit purpose shall see benefyte come surely continew still doted ignorance bycause baptyzed soone came intoo world doo shewe therin leaud vnthankfulnesse falsifye god truth much man counterfet seale felonie though cace fyue shilling drowned ignorance cannot abyde bee drawen falsifyers forger thing worth al world heere cace concerneth ratifying thing haue bin purchaced v death passion sonne god hath bin declared alredy furthermore let v marke also saint paule speaketh woord full instruction edifyeth fayth pron uncing corruption dead thing therefore god hath blynded ryghtfull vengeance thinke themselues haue sacrament styll yit notwithstanding without woord example deede baptyzing mumble ynough make theyr coniurations charmes vnknowen language yit speaking rather diuel godfather godmoothers answer teaching child common instruction whole church bee short popish baptim woord therefore much lye h haue abolished baptim yit notwithstanding god hath suffered rememberance goodnesse bee vtterly put away lyke tyme lawe although priestes ioolaters preached false doctrine imbrewed simple people many errours fals opinios yit notwithstanding circumcision chaunged tymes ezechias io thing redressed god seruice set ryght state bycause bin ordeyned god lawfull haue taken signe couenant vtterly away behoued forsake income bin put sata policie euen say popedome woord god respect pretend minister sacramentes yit wee sticke receyue thing witnessed vntoo v baptim though infected much thinesse wee must renounce creame ministred vntoo v wicked trash reteyne pure institution lord iesus christ furthermore let v vnderstand baptim wee receyued bin vnauaylable nay rather bin cursed treacherie wee gone wee bin peruerted wee falsifyed ordinance lord iesus christ lyke cace supper truth supper remayning adayes poperie call god table flat mockage reproche death passion lord iesus christ bycause knit vnseparable bond masse wee knowe masse vtter renouncing sacrifyze made sonne god howseuer cace stand although vsed conuenient resemblance institution lord iesus christ yit haue woord mumble betweene teeth consecrating terme spiritual sacrament haue peruerted doo vse prattle vppon bread blowe vppon chaunge intoo bodie iesus christ least seeming also chatter ouer chalice beare themselues hand chaunged haue made alteration though able create new world much make peece bread become sonne god haue created whole world satan hath bewitched papistes beeleeue doo power god woord howbeeit sayd woord saint paule treateth heere bare found teaching edifyeth fayth wee receyue promis made v apply se end baptim water may warrant spirituall washyng also wee receyu bread wyne supper infallible pauleactes c wash away thy sinnes baptim euen shewe washing v water wee see vayne deceyuable figure iesus christ dooth deede accomplish thing shewed face therfore wee must beare well mynd yit woord vyces flesh froward affection wheruntoo wee bee much wedded yee see dubble grace wee receyue lord iesus wit bycause hath satisfyed v discharged v dettes wee come god ryghtuous sinnes layed charge wee bee reconcyled freely leastwyse respect selues howbeit raunsome iesus christ hath offered yit notwithstanding ment god haue v let alone styll vncleannesse also drawe v holy spirit therefore necessitie foresayd washing ould bee matched regeneration cause saint paule iesus christ hath washed v end wee excell beautie yea bee vnblamable also b fore wheras se teth v foorth bee honorable glorious dooth woord vseth import hath eye backe thinges treated concerning men wyues goeth foreward treating spirituall wedlocke betweene sonne god v wherof speake yit length hereafter therfore lyke man loue wyfe shee lyking saint paule telleth v text sonne god wyll lyke well v wee weare badge giueth v say first vppon knowledge owne wretchednesse wee humble selues seeke pardon hath purchaced v end beyng quit god hand wee may call vppon full trust one poynt also wee bee renewed power wee followe worldly lustes giue libertie wicked affection rather fyght ageinst selues labour put away thing wee haue selues god may reigne lyue v wee bee gouerned holy spirit lyfe may bee nothing else yeelding obedience holy wyll yee see beautie wyll make v acceptable sonne god namely beautie adorned corruptible deckings beautie commeth beyng clenzed staynes fayth beyng sanctifyed holy ghost wee may lyue continually newe creature effect thing wee haue beare mynde sayd iesus christ giuen v redemption saint paule declareth therwithall doone namely bycause sayeth giuen v bee wisedome1 cor ryghtuousnesse holynesse bee wisedome wyttes myght rest vppon wander one way agein giuen v bee ryghtuousnesse intent bee spot wrinckle v wee appeere face god blud iesus christ bee sufficient vncorruptnesse v also giuen v sanctification holinesse intent wee bee renewed holy spirit whosoeuer separateth thing one another intendeth rend iesus christ peeces much lyeth would wee bee parttakers spirituall washing wherof saint paule treateth heere let v looke wee bee holy wee walke pure conuersation god bee doone owne power cunning attributed heere iesus christ saint paul sheweth office make v excellent certein men needes come presumptuousnesse may well inforce themselues yit shall bee neuer neerer v wee must suffer lord iesus christ woorke v holy spirit meanes shall wee bee passyng beautifull may haue delyght v cause also doth say may present vnto beawtifull glorious church saying declareth al outward shewe gay glistering wee haue worldward smoke wee must haue purenesse hart could haue sayd lord iesus hath clensed churche intent pure ryghtuous intended expresse purenenesse cleannesse please syght world wee may prayzed commended heere belowe hipocrits men gape gaze great way clapping hand esteeming holyer angel much better man bee precyze walk playnly bee imperfection let knowen yit hold full pace still hauing feare god vnfeynedly whyle wherfore folowing instruction saint paules let v learne set selues presence sonne god commeth ordering lyfe let v looke knowing eyther wee must bee allowed else wee gayne nothing exalted commended heere beneathe though men haue neuer maruelous opinion v say shalbee mere vanitie leazing till wee haue ruled framed lyfe wyse wee walked face sonne god howbeeit deede nothing bee hidden wee haue remember saint paule sayeth end church bee without spot w le vnrebukable holinesse meaneth accomplshed performed v alredie bee long wee bee compassed ab ut bodie prizon bondage wee dragge shackle v continually whyle wee bee heere beneathe although wee haue profited well feare god yit must wee bee fayne say alwayes saint paulerom wee hild miserable bondage cannot serue god halues ye would say howbeeit paule ment also shewe simply whertoo wee bee called intent w e hye v thitherward tyme lyfe end redemption wherfore wee reconcyled god wherfore
