made v wherin consisteth saluation therin twoo inseperable poynts wit forgiuenesse sinnes newbirth sayd seuen thirtith ezechiell thirteenth ieremie effect euery thing cannot bee put asunder namely god dooth receyue adopt v wee neede still haue sinnes forgiuen v till wee bee ridde quyte cleane al earthly corruption agein wee must go foreward dayly newnesse lyfe yit still diuells incarnate would abolish remission sinnes insomuch dare slaunder v farre say wee hold men stil apcie whe make beleeue must need sinner still neuerthelesse certein whosoeuer wil bee christian must needes sinner straunge first sight yit moued holy gost1 iohn c saint iohn speaketh doctrine god wee say sayeth wee haue sin wee make god lyer truth v wee imagin selues bee holy wee haue sin v shall god bee lyer fancy sake also wee wil bee christian ought wee bee christes disciple wee bee desyrous learne schoole maner praying vntoo god father principall poynt teacheth vsmath b doth shew v giue v offence wee beseech god dayly forgiue v greate man intend raze petition crauing forgiuenesse faultes forsaketh schoole iesus christ let v vnderstand world wee cannot bee without spot wri kle wee must bee clenzed little little vyces whertoo wee bee giuen must bee corrected peecemeale vntyll wee come perfection spoken first chapter bee short long wee bee worlde forasmuch wee haue many sinnes vyces v let v bee heedfull praying vntoo god shewe himselfe alwayes mercifull towardes v bearing v forgiuing misdeedes yit notwithstanding let v therwithall take hart fight ageinst vyces yeeld selues obedient god let v vse force violence subdew passion lustes vntyll wee haue gotten vpper ha euill though wee ceasse commit although sinne dwell v yit let reigne v thus yee see wee must day day continew exercyze presenting selues god humilitie beseeching pardon offence yit notwithstanding profite renewment spoken heere tyll wee bee wholly fashyoned lyke ryghtuousnesse glory god let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment faultes praying make v feele wee may bee sorie streyne selues followe seruice wee may shewe deedes lyfe long hath redeemed v vayne tyrannye satan set v libertie euen serue free giue selues wholly glorifying holy name therwithall let v beseeche also graunt v grace taste benefytes bestoweth vppon v may prouoke v glorify may bee continuall exercyze study sing preach prayses alwayes acknowledge greatly wee bee bound detted vntoo meanes lord iesus may reigne ouer v wee may bee linked vnseparable vntyll wee come ringdome hath bought deerly v may please graunt grace v also people c xli sermon nyenth vppon fifth chapter men ought loue vvyues ovvne bodyes loueth vvyfe loueth himselfe man euer yit hated ovvne fleshe rather nurrisheth cherisheth lord also dooth churche vvee bee member body fleshe bone seeing holy scripture exhorteth v kynd harted meeke patient one another setteth v downe example god reconcyled v person sonne lord iesus christ sheweth v therewithall iesus christ spared shewed loue bare v care saluation gaue himselfe hard bitter death must needes bee harte harder steele bee meekened yit notwithstanding exhortation cannot suffyze v reason wylfulnesse corruption god therfore put v greater shame sendeth v backe order nature sayd although neuer heard word god mouth neuer teaching holy scripture yit ought euery v enter intoo himselfe consider state wyll ynough hold v conuicted without witnesse could heathen men tell v full well hauing nother beleefe god religion could notwithstanding well skill saye wyld beastes make warre one ageinst another one woolfe eateth another beares lyon lyue abrode wyld wood haue certein thing holdeth order hurt one another yit haue discretion among men haue naturall ouing driueth loue one another euery lyueth quietly fellowe must needes bee men altoogither square doo despyze god nature seeing lyue like dogges cattes say euery man woolfe foxe neyghbour nothing craftinesse malice else vtter crueltie cause god telleth v wee bee one fleshe one kynd esay vseth reason perswade v succour neyghbours haue pitie compassion stand neede thou shalt despyze thine owne fleshe sayeth furthest straunger world neuer separated v thatesay b wee spring one fountayne wee ought acknowledge bee image therefore whosoeuer disdeyneth man surely foregetteth himselfe much knoweth nother woorthy honorable degree wherin god hath set bycause peruerteth order reason ought take place generall much ought men bee touched quicke told bee specially seeing bee linked toogither much streyter bond man saye father thou bee farre loue thy sonne thou art vnwylling see disdeynest talke fynd meanes come attonement thee crueltie thy fleshe thy blud canst thou bee blynded thyne excessiue moode consider god hath giuen thee though come thyne owne person sonne bee sayde lykewyse meete thou shouldest bee borne intoo world haue roome place among god child meane whyle forget thy father begate thee whose meanes god sent thee intoo world holyest band god hath set among v bond betweene man wyfe cause saint paule sayth man cannot loue wyfe must loue self contrariwyse despyze wyfe hate hir one fall oddes self possible heretoofore exhorted husband doo duetyes hauing eye example lord iesus christ alledged sonne god giuen self death wash churche although poore miserable ful filth vncleannesse suffered needefull ou saluation lefte v moreouer record grace hath purchaced v insomuch b btim wee haue visible token blu lord iesus christ washing cle zing think vppon thing bee moued gentlnesse yea wee consider first wee ee wr tched woormes earth short nothing v vtter miserie wee may well ee called vermin caryons full corruption lothsomnesse afterward compare selues sonne god ought bee pryde v esteeme commend selues read others vnder feete bee generall men sayd shall bee betweene man wyfe knot god hath knit betwixt husband yee would say half self may separate selfe fro wyfe tha wyfe may separate hir selfe fro hir husband eche must haue regard owne state shalbee declared end hath bin partly declared alredie husband deede head woman bodie wheras head hath preheminence souereintie ouer bodie dooth therefore follow hold scorne bee glad haue shamed reproched dooth honour head extend whole body forasmuch husband sufficiently moued reason taken lord iesus christ saint paule bringeth backe originall asmuch heathen folk vnbeleeuers acquaynted mariage giuen indgment therfore wee neede holy scripture sayeth teache v behalf ignorant soules natural vnderstanding walked moother wit directed knew wyfe peece husband goeth inseparable bond betwixt one ought forsake vnlesse teare themselues peeces seeing blynd wretch perceyued shame inlyghtened god woord haue bin taught familiarly household folk euen father hath eye vppon child bee ignoraut seeing say god speaketh familiarly v weere month mouth sheweth v telleth v deutie must need bee woorse fidels much greeuously bee condemned wee continew hard har stop eares least wee myght receyue aduyce giueth v let v marke well seeing saint paule hath set v foorth lord iesus christ example told v giuen v good reason considering wee bee linked vntoo wee shewe selues willing follow fashyon selues lyke vnto pitying distresse bearing paciently vyces infirmity neyghbours releeuing haue neede v wee may conueniently haue wherwithall let v think well vppon agein forasmuch heere mention made man wyfe let maryed consider damnation prepared bee moued touched quicke thing told heere namely one syde heathen folk shall ryze vp giue witnesse ageinst latter day syde order nature teacheth haue doo liue concord freendship shewed doo wilfully withstand god yea vtterly forget themselues become woorse brute beastes furthermore let knowe also forasmuch mariage figure holy vnion betweene god al faythfull ought also hold greater reuerence although happen many contention yit ought subdew let lye dead consider sith lord iesus sitteth ouer shewe wedlocke blissed wyse god father first himselfe also hath ratifyed blissing death passion yea reconcyled v god wyse husband may perceyue lyuely picture one wyfe howbeeit wyse vnder obedience god twayne ought serue one accord euen vntyll bee farre foorth bee come hym cleaue throughly perfection although warning ought bee great force among v yit fewe touched according world see let man looke intoo housholdes one another shall fynd freendship may resemble iesus christ church nowhere man wyfe rather euer iarring disagreeing happen bee fond yit feare god least occasion world wyll bee ynough set oddes shall forget conteyned heere say truth neuer thinke loue betwixt led prouoked lustes grounded vpon knowledge haue discharging dewtie husband considereth ought beare wyfe ought guyde hir feare god ought loue hir helper allotted vntoo ease myght walke hee ought doo wyfe humbleth hir selfe hir husband bendeth hir wittes please bycause shee perceyueth shee expressely giuen vntoo bee furtherance hinderance vntoo talke inckling al bee well considered say common ordinarie state euery house man shall fynde diuelishnesse cursyng banning blasphemie swearing spytefulnesse harming although w man bee feend towardes hir neyghbours well shee towardes hir husband yit hir husband wealth good hir must take hir part without discretion maynteyne hir quarrell good bad say man may see peruersenesse reygneth welneere euerywhere agein euery man complaynes wyfe saying cannot liue hir mad beast nothing hir pryde peeuishnesse nothing hir froward stubbornnesse cannot speake woord hir shee paye mee agein foure surely men make wyues haue spake namely men doo spyte god maynteyne wyues wrongfull quarelles ought god yeeld deserued hyre make rebound backe vppon owne pate whatsoeuer say man marke well e ery man ordinarie trade lyfe shall fynde may bee sorte fond loues forte excessiue affection well ordered frendship dependeth vppon god grounded woord hardly shal among hundred house fynd one husband wyfe well qualifyed yit notwithstanding wee bee vnexcuzable wee profit doctrine euery v must fyght ageinst vnruly affection man haue wyfe could wish let vnderstad god intendeth try pacience meanes let consider wel behaueth himselfe woorse towardes lord iesus christ husband v maryed therefore let bee rigorous towardes wyfe seeing himselfe deserueth bee humbled bee short let euery man mynd doctrine husband hath thing wife desyreth may thinke thus yit bound vntoo hir yea onely bound vntoo wyfe also vntoo god mayster mariage lord iesus christ mirrour lyuely image vntoo v therefore bound doo duetie towardes hir loue hir beare hir although bee vyces hir yit ment husband foster feede wyues vyces wee must warne counsell one another must bee neerenesse linking toogither husband see thing amisse wife must leastwyse tel hir yea rebuke hir labour indeuer bring hir intoo right way much possibly yit howsoeuer world go long wee bee maried standes continually wee cannot chaunge order lord hath set yea euen bee vnuiolable therfore wee must passe person insomuch although woman haue rough sharp husband one dealeth ouer hardly hir yit must shee alwayes consider hir husband god matched toogither allotted hir portion bycause shee woorthie let hir also enter intoo examination hir sinnes shee may pray god take away rod deale gently hir lyke wyfe must hir syde continue bond mariage submit hir selfe euen without respecting hir husband husband hath wyfe lyking let thinke lykewyse wyfe dooth hir duetie cannot lyue hir yit dooth wedlocke dure styll ordeyned god forget duetie reuenge mee wife fall stoutnesse without regarding belongs charge ageinst mortall creature shall bend selfe husband ouershootes himselfe sorte surely fyghteth ageinst god indeuereth disanull thing inuiolable nature let euery v put doctrine better vre owne behalfe let onely maryed folkes also men generall vnderstande wee cannot estraunge selues one another become vnkynde mercilesse vnpacient one toward another wee must bee witlesse creature haue reason regard whence come end wee liue world effect thing haue beare mynd wee rgarded well prophet reasonesay b surely wee shoulde bee moued exhortation set heere man euer hat ovvne flesh nurrisheth cherisheth euery v gaue himselfe consider care hath owne person tenderly cherisheth partes bodie euen least toe foote carefully forecasteth nothing may want prouident respectes member bee ill ease indeuereth remedye may maynteyne health say euery v bethought throughly fashyon surely would bee good teaching v doo lyke neyghbours say al men much consequently father child child father husbandes wyues wyues husbandes foorth mutually according hath pleased lord linke v neerer bond haue sayde afore body reply heereuntoo ush selfe answer must needes followe thou art man sayde afore god creating maynteyning v condition wee bee one masse though bee many finger many ewe man bodie yit let bee one thing nother impeachment one member succour another well selfe vnkyndly bodie fall banding deuiding selfe intoo faction nother possible euery v bee wedded owne profit meane whyle disdeyne others pryde else bee cruell hee see misery world hath compassion releeue fynd har beare thing forgiue signe wee haue forgotten owne nature wherfore intent wee may fare better doctrine let v wey well woordes saint paule neuer man hated owne fleshe euery man nurrisheth cherisheth neede wee schoolemayster teache v needeth god send v angel heauen neede wee take much payne learne art cunning wee bee much giuen alredy nature sith euery v beares owne euidence rolled record ageinst himselfe owne indytement redie framed shall neede long examination god carefull men haue bin owne bodyes forecasting haue bin mayntenance bee short mo signes shewe louing themselues greeuouslyer shall bee condemned god bycause haue doone lyke towardes owne flesh yea though vnknowen furthest countrie world sayd afore bee generall shall become sonne setteth himselfe outrage stubbornnesse ageinst father hath meeknesse suffer himselfe bee gouerned euen vtterly shaketh ought spend himselfe euen death also father syde vse nothing bitternesse toowardes child gouerne wyse prouoke impacience husbandes deale roughly wyues may vtterlye discorage cast intoo sorrowe shall let themselues looce fall disorderedly manner leaudnesse woman lykewyse bee stiffenecked cannot bee brought good order say disorder among v let v assure selues needeth none record condemne v care euery v hath himselfe wee haue bin myndfull owne welfare labored earnestly meane whyle broken bond lord set among v euery v drawen alone forgotten duetie louing kyndnesse insomuch wee would wee could haue made euery v new world truly man abilitie forbeare helpe neyghbours yit wee loth neyghbours dwel v yea bee counted number men man would reigne alone lyke lord vnkyndnesse leaudnesse sufficient shewe wee bee woorthie inioy benefytes god dealeth v transitory lyfe sith wee bee much wedded vntoo mynd carefully wee wee bee giltie man may open mouth reply alledge excuce himselfe saint paule hauing told v wee ought knowe yea iudge owne nature returneth agein hee touched afore wit professe themselues bee member bodie lord iesus christ ought bee perswaded example liue quietly freendly agreeingly wyues man sayeth loueth self loueth wyfe also uerely god hath ordeyned wedlocke wyse wyfe must bee bodie hir husband therfore man loue self wyfe must bee matched else shalbee monstruous loue thing men ought abhorre thing holy man lyfe bee vtterly abaced seeing loueth self loue wyfe wee bee flesh wee bee bone heere toucheth thing hee spake set downe example lord iesus christ alledging spared self shead blud wash v filthinesse vncleannesse defyled stayned god lord iesus christ found meanes bring v fauour agein euen owne bludshed heere hee alledgeth another reason confirme matter yit better wee bee bone bone flesh flesh saying dooth v vnderstand men doo theyr duetie theyr owne benefyte therby may taste inestimable infinite grace god euery man accordyng degree dooth mariage represent vnion betweene selues lorde iesus christ thing therfore saint paule intendeth yit agayne remoue ha dnesse harte shewing v wee cannot inioy grace purchaced v lord iesus christ vnlesse wee lyue freendshyp togither accordyng image therof wee haue loue bare v death passion whiche surmo nteth loue wee haue one another howbeeit wee goe let v see sense saint paule saith wee bee bone lord iesus christ flesh member body descended adam linagerom called seede dauid although conceyued kynd kyndnesse haue onely despyzed god woorde also forgotten condition created worlde knewe euen naturall reason could haue shewed come poynt bin doted lust lyke woode beast surely rage reigning inordinate lust flesh bee repressed feare god thereof came many country lawfull men haue three foure wyues peece permitted still day among turk iewes also notwithstanding lawe moyses put away wyues euery small occasio came heades woman fayre ynough shee rich ynough shee diuorced trew lord prouyded howbeeit halfemath deede lord iesus christ declareth god regard hard hartednesse people past amendment taming therefore listed put away wyfe bound giue hir testimoniall shee harlot shee lyked choze rather susteyn shame keepe fayth mariage putting away wyfe plyghted hir fayth liue dye hir shewed himselfe forsworne vnfaythfull therefore reproch put away theyr wyues sort yit diuorces common lord iesus sayth dooyng iewes backestyders lawe god therfore telleth beginning tooke libertie sayd found himselfe well ease wyfe giue hir leaue depart lord iesus telleth trew god graunted father howbeeit bycause fayne deale wyld beastes graunted lawfull yit knowe yee although punished rigour yit ment therefore take occasion doo yit woorse therefore haue yee eye alwayes beginning god created adam shaped eue syde sayde tyme twoo bee one fleshe taketh twoo wyues woorthy bee cut asunder take three woorthy bee cut three peeces one would defye god nature seeyng god hath printed marke person man wyfe intent wedlocke bee kept ought bee wherfore man disanull ordinance god deserueth bee wyped alledged example pretend bee hot mayntenance wyues quarelles abrode yit diuelles home loue saint paule speaketh right good affection man beareth wyfe bycause hee knoweth god hath knit togither though put togither owne hand sayd lyue two togither peace concord agein touching wyues bycause bee loth beare yoke god hath layed vppon theyr shoulder therefore text saint paule put mynd god author wedlocke hath set downe condition wyfe bee subiect hir husband suffer hirselfe bee ruled hir head beare reuerence woman alwayes find matter ynough hir husband despyze haue goodnesse shee go deface shee may haue occasion say man haue preheminence ouer mee able rule wee knowe ouerweening men woman euery one thinkes himselfe able fellowe wyues therfore would feyne gouerne haue maystrie cause dooth saint paule tell must abyde state god hath put wit subiection must stand scannyng husbandes examin whether bee woorthy haue authoritie superioritie must consider god hath ordeyned obey without geynsaying replying must inquyre intent fynd excuce exempt themselues obeying god commaundementes therfore wee must giue eare euery v must without geynsaying receyue thing commaundeth v thus yee see thing bee vnderstoode spoken concerning feare subiection wyues owe husband doctrine cleere familiar ynough self yit practyzed worlde folke would fayne alledge excuce ignorance shift performance dewtie saying hygh hard vnderstoode sayd men ought loue wyues needeth gloze expound holy ghost ment thing euident ynough selfe euery man knowes vnderstandes well ynough yee looke vppon loue men beare wyues scarsely shall yee fynd one among hundred could fynd hart giue ouer hath wandering fancy head woman also lyght mynded could fynd harte bee vnmaryed twentie tymes yeere wherof commeth euen haue eye vntoo god author mariage truely though wee scripture sayd yit would brutishest man world reuerence mariage ycause lordes leaue record ingrauen men harte meaning shewe sith ignorant grossest sort vnderstand man wyfe ioyne good loue euery one degree men must bend way wee haue teaching wee haue exhortation added spurre v foreward intent wee latter selues vyces yit wee better bee seene dayly men storme wyues wyues checke husbandes ordinarie matter euery house euer among flye flyng cursings banning short nothing frowardnesse dis eyne thing vnpossible man wyfe haue accesse come vntoo god manner ought repayring vntoo god bee wee myght receyue mercy vnder protection haue care v prayer saint peter sayeth expresly1 pet b man ouersharp rigorous wyfe wyfe also hir syde stubborne able weeld hir meanes shee willing submit hir self shee ought doo prayer broken say wretched folk wheron think yee yee verie miserable seing gate shet ageinst yee cannot call vppon god become v wee cannot betake selues intoo hand god better v bee drowned hundred thousand tymes seeing god loueth quietnesse bothe men woman commaunding v liue peace concorde moreouer iddeth come vntoo saying husband gouerneth wyfe quietly wyfe hir syde dooth hir dewtie yee call vppon mee heare mouth seeing say lord calleth v owne benefyte welfare commaundeth v call vppon pure hart must need possessed diuell haue forgone al wit wee accept good profitable conditon therfore let v mark wel husband intend discharge dewtie wyfe lykewyse bothe must haue eye vntoo god hold mariage assuring themselues met al aduenture lord cuppled toogither end husband bee companion wyfe receyue hir part self wyfe yeeld degree honour hir husband belongeth respect god submit hir self hir head thus best may herken vnto god obey cace take authour wedlocke bee ruled thing let husband trubble self much looking vppon fault wyfe say shall doo caryon wee knowe reproches lothsome heynous also let wyfe looke thing hir husband say diuel cannot bee wonne meanes let hir hold hir condition shee bound vntoo let hir ask wherfore god hath put hir subiection nother let hir make hir self glorious setting vp hir bri e ageinst god putting hir subiection bee taken bodie wee come linage adam bycause wee liue owne substanceiohn f according saying flesh meate blud drink wherby meaneth wee liue howbeit spiritually deede wee haue common lyfe talke walk men proceedeth speciall grace lord iesus christ yit mouing wee haue common brute beast proceedeth also according sayd lyfe thingsiohn b yea saint iohn passeth yit saying woord say lord iesus christ quicken men god hath giuen speciall priuiledge hauing vnderstanding discretion spirituall lyfe wee haue sonne god spoken thing aboue nature although wee haue woorthinesse excellencie wee come moothers womb yit remayneth alwayes print image god yit wee bee cursed owne nature miserable wee bee called euen deceassed dead cause lord iesus christ sayethiohn houre come dead rotten carkesses graue shall heare voyce sonne god saint paul hath sayd second chapter wee bee reformed lord iesus christ wee lyue whereas erst wee dead sinnes trangressions bycause wee receyue father adam inheritance maner therfore wee bee iesus christes flesh bone bone wee bee graffed intoo body accordingly saint paul also vseth similitude graffyngrom lyke sine set intoo stocke taketh sustenance must wee graffed intoo lord iesus christ trew doo yit bring foorth good fruite selues purpose heere shewe braunche withereth broken roote let alone receyueth sap nurrishment fro roote bee graffed intoo another euen v wit wee continew wee bee kynde wee death bycause wee bee separated lord iesus christ wee bee incorporated intoo please communicate himselfe vnto v doo feele deede bread doth nurrishe v whe wee eate wyne strengthen v better drink wee verily receyue lyfe strength body blud lord iesus christ hygh misterie euery man able iudge himselfe wee haue debated neuer much scanned matter harte v comprehend wee bee knit lord iesus christ wee bee made one wee assure warrant selues wee shall meane bee parttakers god glorie euen day wee liue lord iesus christ according saying hisiohn c bee good cheere liue shall also say enter intoo small roome sensuall reason surely cause number men cannot admit poynt wee bee flesh iesus christ bone bone content themselues owne imagination abacing god grace saint paule able expresse rather shewed v ought rauish wittes woonder many may happen haue rouing heathenish imagination bee knit vnto lord iesus christ say wee bee saued grace scripture goeth though saying great misterie yit let v beware limiting owne fancie al one wee would make saint paule lyer despyze spirituall coniunction wee haue lord iesus christ would shewe secret wonderfull power god aught else wee heare spoken heere holy ghost vseth speeche humble v afterward oo exalt v agein therefore wee must one syde confesse wisedome wit wee haue dooth fayle v behalfe afterward ryze vp agein heare lord iesus christ call v tell v wee bee knit vntoo hath thing owne maketh common v wherof haue v bee parttakers therfore wee haue contrarye motion selues come intoo heades say possible lord iesus christ heauen nurrish v owne substance body bee meate blud drinke say wee fall intoo fancy must repulse sayd namely great secret wee must rebuke owne folly rashnesse intending measure thing infinite lord sheweth v hath knit v sonne hath doone high profound woorke surmounteth capacitie seeing let v alwayes conclude although wee fynde straunge matter yit must wee rest vppon thing spoken god himselfe specially sayth woorke hygh fashyon wee shalbee vtterly rauished wherefore let v learne generally vppon text benefytes wee receyue meanes lord iesus christ thereby atteine heauenly lyfe doo proceede fayd fountaine god incomprehensible wisedome v bee foolish presump uous say knowe agein see pleaseth mee let v restreyne selues presumption make v vnwoorthy misterie fayth bycause saying importeth great secret end say whereat wee must begin mynd fare better iesus christ bee parttakers grace vnderstand god woorking saluation great misterie secret according text alledged heertoofore epistle timothie great misterie sayth saint paule god manifested flesh1 tim great distance betweene god man wee wormes rottennesse god maiestie hygh man say conceyue hundredth part thought wee must fayne bee rauished woonder seeyng god hath linked himselfe vntoo v trew emanuell named esayesay c thing seeme farre asunder knit togither person lord iesus christ let v conclude theruppon nothing mystery secretes grace wee receyue god specially incorporating graffing intoo lord iesus christ hauing taken nature vppon clothed himselfe fleshe haue v bee graffed roote bee quickened spirit bee parttakers lyfe hath nothing peculiar alone haue common vnto v wee receyue lord iesus christ benefytes bringeth v wee meanes ouercome temptation crosse v wee must tast throughly thinges holy scripture telleth v setteth afore v giue reuerend credit vnto acknowledging god woorketh v lord iesus christ may content v make v forsake owne naturall vnderstanding let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment sinnes praying voutsafe pardon v wyse wee may bee rid gouerne v holy spirit may indeuer liue according holy wil reforme whole lyfe according holy commaundementes beare infirmites vntyll hee haue wholly reformed v bring v perfection whertoo wee labour atteyne let v say almyghtie god c xliii sermon first vppon sixth chapter child obey father moothers lord ryght honour thy father thy moother first commaundement promis thou mayst fare vvell bee long lyued vppon earth father prouoke child wrath nurrishe vp nurture vvarnings lord resorting vntoo sermon must bee onely heare thing wee knewe also bee stirred vp doo dewtie bee wakened wee bee othfull drowzie good holy warning bee r buked bee stubbornnesse malice v thing saint paule telleth v heere euery v ought haue ingrauen harte thing v vnderstand moother wit child ought bee obedient subiect father moothers also ought bee gentlenesse haue child gouerne vse myldly giue cause frowardnesse ouer great roughnesse say knowen well ynough men yit warning giuen v heere needeth dischargeth himselfe thing told v heere saint paule father moothers doo dyuers tymes marre child cockering make cocknyes leade vtter vndooing agein somtymes bee choler heates without measure discretion haue hold themselues indifferent dealing ought bee child although bee sufficiently proued ought bee obedient subiect parentes dooth world see despyze hold vtter scorne nother almost hold themselues awe yeeld ryght reuerence father moothers respect god hath bound ought doo therefore sith wee see heere saint paule exhorteth faythfull thing common therein wee may perceyue frowardnesse owne nature th se thing wee ought bee put mynd euery v ought bee inclyned himselfe doo dewtie without warning god spirit rebuketh v fleshly although wee knowe thing bee ryghtfull may bee yit wee cannot giue selues wherfore let v indeuer fyght ageinst owne vyces ynough v haue learned wee ought doo also forasmuch much fyghting stryuing selues ageinst wee knowe god ryghtuous conuenient euery v must enter intoo himselfe beware drawe cleane backe imprison bridle himselfe beare wel mynd ynough haue bin instructed taught vnlesse also thrust foorth himselfe force subdue wicked affection hard euer bee bring passe let v come sayd heere yee child sayth saint paule obey father moothers trew paule alledgeth afterward god hath lawe set downe generall terme wit honour god ment doo v vnderstand child ought yeeld bothe subiection reuerence father moothers one myght yeeld obedience subiection myght neuerthelesse haue spytefull proud loftie hart despyze partie serueth lord commaundeth v honour father moothers therunder meaneth comprehend reuerence moreouer performance dewtie wit child vnderstand bee bound serue father moothers subiect thing vttermoste power yee see generally god haue child bee obedient subiect parent also yeeld reuerence moreouer doo dewtie towards succoring dooing ease comfort assuring themselues owne owne libertie owe seruis vntoo whose meanes came intoo world saint paule sayeth expresly lord meaning dubble bond hold v subiection first order nature agein god telleth v hath set v earthly lyfe condicion father moothers haue superioritie ouer child heathen men shal fayle bee found giltie though lawe direct taught doctrine wee heare mouth saint paule insomuch chyld stubborne ageinst father mother among heathen abhorred nother greate small could iudge nother shall scape god hand sith bee condemned alredy world sayd afore thing grauen hart v also manifest may bee howbeit besyds wee knowe naturally god addeth owne ample confirmation telleth v hath ordeyned appoynted therfore wee must passe way sith wee perceyue god holdeth v vnder awe father moothers certein wee bee much vnexcuzable euery v submit self meeknesse humilitie haue followed order nature among heathen poore blynd soules shalbee iudges hath stirrred vp theruntoo helpes wee haue yit performed dewtie thing saint paule intended saying child ought obey theyr father moothers lord addeth ryght say man shal gayne thing stryuing behalf wee knowe man mynd full fraught pryde man hee would bee lord subiection irketh men yeeld vntill lord haue framed v holie spiritvvis b cause also spirit god called spirit meeknesse gentlenesse whygala bycause pryde maketh men lyke wyld beast puffeth vp lyke toades cannot humble themselues saint paule therfore perceyuing vyce rooted nature mynding redresse sheweth ryght becommeth euery man imploy self theruntoo although bee sturdinesse v wil suffer v bee subiect superiours yit ryghtfulnesse god say rule hath set must ouerwey sayeth ryght ryghtfull bringeth v backe god authoritie say seeyng god hath sayd woorde scanning matter men must stop mouthes seeyng god hath commaunded men must obey assuring themselues wyll sure infallible rule lawfull swarue nother ryght syde left good warning wee see although men willing doo well good zeale towardes yit euery v bee wyze owne conceyt commeth guyding gouerning selues wee needes beare sway aboue woorde god forasmuch men fond presumptuous attribute somewhat continually owne wit standeth v hand marke well sayd heere wit wee must haue discretion skill perceyue god commaundeth alloweth lykewyse disalloweth haue wee warrant god wee must bee contented say pleaseth mee ryghtfull though wee perceyue reason agein bee hardnesse yit let v aske nother let v reply ageinst god whe condemneth thing seemeth bee vtterly euyll eye let v say beware malapertnesse diuelishe rashnesse let v followe saint paule telleth v heere wit euer god hath vttered woord ryghtfull wee also must auow bee without geynsaying trew proofe fayth obedience wee thinke ought haue bin commaunded forbidden yit accept good auaylable bycause god hath spoken hereuppon saint paule alledgeth commaundement lawe honour thy father thy moother agein addeth first commaundement promis say god intended bring v meanes subiection wee yeeld father mother ought suffyze v acceptable god seeyng allureth v moreouer gentlenesse fray v authoritie force promyseth prosper v seruing father moothers ought make v lyke better subiection therefore saint paule hauing shewed v wee must bee subiect father mother except wee bee rebel god bend horne ageinst turne ryght order vpsyde downe addeth wee shall bee tootoo hard harted wilfull stubborne god commauding v promis moue v wherby intendeth induce v graciously doo thing willeth v surely wee bee moued yea euen meekened may well bee sayd diuell reigneth wholly v possesseth harte saying commaundement hath speciall promis hath none commaundement lawe promis wee shall liue long vppon earth yea prosperitie bycause god blisse v wee honour meanes whereby wee came world syde sheweth dewtie father mother towardes child wit voutsafeth create v set v world liue brute beast also reigne child haue dominion ouer creature sayd goodnesse mercie extend euen assespsal b ox horse maketh earth beare hay cattell dooth therin shewe cannot looke vp heauenward hygh lowe wee may perceyue thousand yea infinite record god goodnessepsal c ende shyneth sunne giue v lyght moone starres ordeyned doo v seruis yit noble creature may bee insomuch heathen folk woorshipped thinking godhead inclozed agein wee looke downward wee see good thing god hath appoynted vse although feede beasts1 cor b yit end redoundeth v according saint paule speaketh saying hath god care beast say god voutsafeth succour beast neede prouidence doth men saks seing god hath harborowed v sort make v possesse many good thing besyds creating v owne image purchaced v death passion lord iesus christ therbey wee see great benefyte meete bee esteemed handes trew many myseries lyfe much better v neuer haue bin borne linger continually wee doo therefore man consider wretched lyfe self number greefes anguish peynes vexation subiect surely say better neuer haue come moothers womb enter sea confuzion see vppon earth neuerthelesse commeth al shal fynd god reason hid secret wisedome behoueth v cast downe eye bycause wee cannot atteyne vntoo howbeit let v vnderstand hope better lyfe taken away soone world bee greatly lamented seeing wee knowe world well wee bee come age discretion know god hath created v glorifyed v world wee must othersyde consider wee haue dishonored thinke continually vppon tyme past remembering wee haue spent must wee doo part therefore must make rehersall yeeres dayes wee may bee put mynd loue honour god wee see greatly bee bound vntoo maynteyning v long tyme pacientnesse towardes v bearing v wee make comparison faultes wee shall haue committed little fault craueth wee bee confounded hand yit notwithstanding continueth styll goodnesse towardes v therefore let v marke well doctrine wit present lyfe byndeth v god bycause maketh v tast fatherly goodnesse voutsafing maynteyne v well extending bounteousnesse towardes v gracious turne correction benefyte behoofe moreouer sheweth v haue v bee inured world knowe father giueth v word sacrament whereby assureth v setting v heere beneath tyme drawe gather v end himselfe therefore wee consider whertoo wee bee called ende wee bee created namely passe worlde bee taken intoo heritage heauen wee shall perceyue present lyfe well woorthie bee esteemed wee consider benefytes god imparteth v heere bee noted heerwithall wee shall neuer haue prosperitie welfare world except god fauour therfore saying thou mayst liue long fare well sheweth hauing long lyfe standeth v hand feele blissing therwith wretched vnbeleuers conceyue thing intend declare wit god powreth rich vppon v intent knowe bee father bee confirmed trusting goodnesse loue may well come greate yeeres doo world lyfe certeyne euer haue shal turne greater condemnation rich wherin ioy toogither delyghts superiours haue rest haue woorme gnaweth conscience alwayes vnquietnesse bee short experience sheweth welfare present lyfe except wee bee blissed god diuersitie bee seene alwayes respect outward apparance yit doo faythfull know well ynough themselues god giueth thing want god promiseth long lyfe also blissing hee say shal liue alonly linger heere beneath get selues greeuouser damnation repyne gnash teethe torment selues affliction misery trubbles tast goodnesse although exempt trubbles comberances greefs world yit shall alwayes haue cheering yee may feele haue forgot take child yea sorrowes greefs shall turne benefyte welfare wheras di ell laboreth keepe comming mee turne away perfect felicitie drawe meanes affliction shall haue world thing therfore wee haue beare mynd bee filled benefyts god bestoweth vppon v world liue ease wee haue desyre knowe god maketh v prosper giueth v lyfe maynteyne v prouyde v thing expedient needfull wherfore let v haue well printed hart wee bee desyrous inioy promis god let euery v looke discharging owne dewtie deede cannot go thing inioyned heere child father mother therfore wil reserue another tyme yit notwithstanding short conclusion let v vnderstand god allureth v dewtie shewing seeketh nothing else welfare benefyte intent wee frank free hart receyue yoke layeth vppon shoulder although irksome thing bee subiect god hath appoynted bee superiours ouer v yit wee haue first condemned selues let v neuerthelesse yeeld sayeth vttereth assuring selues th procureth welfare would fayne win v gentlenesse rigour let make v obedient also generally forasmuch wee see superiority god let v vnderstand wee cannot geynsay wee shall lift vp selues ageinst maiestie bend horne ageinst contrariwyse wee beare subiection willingly wee may assure selues acceptable sacrifyze vnto doubt labour shalbe lost seruing god recompence v promise though deserued aught hand wil doo ouerplus haue declared alredie wee bee bound obey thing commaundeth nother must wee think beholden v think bynd v meanes although wee bee bound wee bee wholly yit ouerflowing goodnesse voutsafeth blisse v make v feele fauour wee haue awfully reuerently followed thing ordeyneth woord recompence wee ought hope god hand howbeeit papistes say ho god promiseth v therfore deserue beare themselues hand god beholden vntoo bycause hath bound himselfe willingly yea free vndeserued goodnesse howbeeit wee must fall intoo dotage vnderstand god beyng whit bound vntoo v dooth notwithstanding voutsafe win v gentlenesse intent wee serue freer mynd cheerfuller corage thus dooth call v wayes therfore much leauder wee wee bow neckes willingly giue selues wholly vntoo without seeking thing onely frame selues good pleasure cheefe rule renounceall owne affection let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment faultes praying voutsafe burye washe v lord iesus christes sake gouerne v wyse holy spirit wee may bee reformed obey wholly holy follow commaundements hath giuen man bee bond free shall receyue lord good shall haue doone maysters like vnto forbearing threates assuring selues lord heauen respecting outward appearance person wee haue seene already besydes generall rule god hath giuen men heere also seuerall warning euery man behaue himselfe degree calling haue seen already husbandes ought bee towardes wyues wyues behaue themselues towardes theyr husbandes gentlenesse parentes ought vse towardes child subiection child ought vse towardes parentes saint paule speaketh maysters seruantes howbeeit seruantes haue adayes tyme seruantes serued yeere two wage hild bondage lyfe death taking bee adayes wee call bondslaues wee neede stand longer haue knowledge yit notwithstanding wee haue great cause prayse god taking away bondage among men doubt excessiue authoritie maysters dayes ouer seruantes hild brute beastes libertie kill euery fault deede prison theyr house keepe locked stock racked rent peeces bee short vsed horribly yea euen beastly yit notwithstanding bycause man naughtinesse lordes wyll state bee styll suffered moreouer wee see euen auowed haue lyued feare god haue excelled church left keepe bondman slaues house howbeeit vsed another manner gentlenesse towardes infidel according wee shall see heere saint paules teaching also reason constreyned maysters sometymes vse greater rigour towardes slaues bycause common prouerb among looke many slaues many enemyes reason holding awe extreme force violence adayes vppon sea called gallie slaues haue alredy touched excessiue trages done vnto great number bondfolke riche men halfe army insomuch fyue thousand slaues one house way haue one throte cut fyue thousand tymes bin good heede taken keepe fettered came sin one mischeef tolleth another vntyll thing bee come vtter confuzion wee consider ryght authority maysters wee alwayes say thing vttterly ageinst order nature wee bee fashyoned image god therefore reasonable creature god hath printed marke bee put reproch tootoo farre square fruites disobedience sin father adam thing turned topsiteruie also part inasmuch seruantes subiection seemeth could meanes plucke neckes collar ought bee lawfull honest excuce doo howsoeuer seruantes fare saint paule commaundeth obey maysters subiect deede dooth also exhort maysters abuse power giuen thinke thing graunted lawe man ryghtfull vnparciall god could bee blamed saint paule counselleth maysters asswage excesse superioritie yit haue seruantes submit themselues beare yoke hard heauy myght seeme seruantes wrong therein rather haue cried ageinst common abuse outrage myght haue bin layd downe haue two principle remember restreyne v attempting chaunge one forasmuch bin god put maynkynd intoo confuzion men great small put mynd adam peruerted order nature therfore paul counselleth seruantes beare subiection assuring themselues commeth god therefore must take paciently gospell serueth chaunge common policy world make lawes belong temporall state trew king prince magistrate ought alwayes aske counsell god mouth frame themselues vntoo word yit lord hath giuen libertie make lawes shall perceyue bee meete conuenient gouernment committed vntoo howbeeit must call vppon god giue spirit wisedome discretion bycause bee abilitie rule themselues must take aduice counsell god woord yit notwithstanding doctrine saluation called kingdome heauenmath c thinges belong brydling v world men may knowe behaue themselues one toowardes another sundrye thinges therefore cause saint paule left slauerye bondage seruiship exhorteth seruants doo dewtie feare trembling say lowelinesse reuerence yea hee addeth singlenesse hart matcheth ageinst fyne slyghts shift wheruntoo seruants slaues tyme much giuen bee seene haue written haue set forth maners trade lif course vse dayes let v mark first paul think ynough seruants seeke benefyte profit maisters willing obey foreward executing whatsoeuer commaunded requyreth reuerence aboue thing sayde afore let seruants vnderstand although bee inforced chastized whipping doo amisse gentle meeke master yit notwithstanding ought beare paciently state wherin bee assuring themselues god alloweth superioritie maysters haue ouer hard greeuous euer neuerthelesse ordeyned stablished god cause setteth downe woord singlenesse wee bee ouer wittie seeking owne aduauntage none v great doctor matter concerning owne profit one say wee haue prerogatiue aboue mee reason bee bound take mee handicraft men neuer knew word learning deale dayly matter thing may make bee skilfull debating cace yee would take bee men lawe forasmuch men wyly seeking owne commoditie profit hinderance others saint paule dooth purposely set downe singlenesse hart serueth sift affection ouerthrowe thing men deuyze hinder themselues dooing dewties setteth downe purposely woords seruing lord cheef foundation wee haue leane vntoo cace concerneth dooing dewtie towards men wee sticke creature wee wil say came wee ark noe bee better esteemed meete bee put vnder feete reason rest woords wee heare euery day wee haue skill ynough alledge exemption little doo wee think selues bound vnto others wee think others bound vntoo v mark therfore al shoote euery man would lord man admit subiection would need followe wee bee wyld beast rather doggs catts men say vntill wee knew god lyketh well seruis wee doo creature wee bee throughly perswaded wee may well make fayre countenance please men mynd shall neuer bee ryght well dispozed vntill wee bee come poynt wee know lord accepteth seruis yit one cause myght hinder v rather coole v discharge dewtie towards men men vnthankfulnesse wee pleasure doo commonly v thank rather think wee bee made none purpose serue wee see requyte seruis euill spyteth v ynough make v leaue altoogither needfull v come backe saint paule telleth v namly god aboue degree hauing superioritie ouer world haue euery man imploy self humblenesse subiections hath ordeyned world remayne firme vnuiolable effect thing saint paule telleth v heere first wee haue mark generall article come touch whe haue superiours ouer v must obey inforcedrom bycause god hath ordeyned preheminence saint paule declareth romanes trew speaketh expressely prince magistrate yit extendeth authoritie parentes haue ouer child husbandes ouer wyues maysters ouer seruantes therefore wee must bee fully perswaded god intent men bee shuffled toogither woulde come passe restreynt rule haue authoritie commaund others vnder obey vnreuocable sentence god wheruntoo wee must hold selues bee contented wee protest selues bee willing obey god meane whyle need remoue order hath set among v wee speake wyth mouth hypocrisie therefore wee must gyue proofe humilitie godward willyng easye bearing man yoke hath layd vppon v owne handes let bee one poynt sayd comprehendeth subiection well people towardes prince magistrate child towardes theyr parentes wyues towardes husbandes also seruantes towardes maysters wee haue wyll bee easie v withstand trubbles incomberances hinder v turne v away dewties cause wee cannot submit selues god wyll sayd disputings vnauaylable fond man shall say bound one shoulde holde foote vppon throte hath giuen authoritie mee seeyng god hath told v haue behoueth v holde peace therfore wee bee fully perswaded wee shall froward wee shewe deedes wee bee willing please god fulfill good wyll mayster haue great multitude folke house shall bee sufficient authoritie appoynt listeth haue ouersyght must obeyed prince hath officer must commaund others must herken simply obey bee doone god souerein lord father hath ryght preheminence dominion ouer v haue v obey hath appoynted without making reply boote say contrarie therefore sayde let v print counsell saint paules throughly harte wee doo dewtie willingly vnfeynedly towardes god hath set authoritie ouer v wee serue god soothly without mynd vertewes wee haue outward shewe worldward shalbee smoke yee shall see number men pretend maruelously well insomuch serue shall bee contented tootoo well although dealing bee allowed among men yit nothing woorth god god bee honored handes wyll haue men inioy theyr ryght wyse nother bee forgotten defaced therefore wee onely obey men despyze thing god haue bee acceptable sacrifyze himselfe dealing let v tend alwayes dedicate selues forasmuch hys wee bee vnderlyngs let v beare yoke willyngly free vnslauishe vnconstreyned mynd cause saint paule sayeth expresly let seruice bee eye seruice though yee sought pleaze men deede play pageantes fayre say seeke eyther recompence else bee well interteyned fed fattest else haue greater wage afterward haue extraordinarye gift reward occasion serueth thing men hunt haue eye vntoo god saint paule telleth v although serue froward wee cannot tell content wee haue hope euer wee shall get valew button hand yit wee must neuerthelesse performe dewties towards god heere wee haue gather thing god commaundeth v wee must onely imploy eye feete handes armes say wee must begin inwar affection therefore saint paule sayeth vvith eye seruice sheweth v wee desyre lord allowe serui good lawfull hart must go foremost guyde member bee counterfetting accordingly sayd regardeth faythfulnesse say wee deale soundlypsal b playnly substancially thus gay showes quyte dasht sayd grea e pre ence vertew many men god accounteth euery whit nothing deede hipo risie therfore wee begin serue god well let v learne leaue dubblenesse wee may buyld substan ially let v alwayes lay foundation accordingly also wee see leuer bee loued feared trew wee owe reuerence wee ought tre ble maiestie yit sheweth v cheef thing quyreth pleaseth best sayeth israel thou shalt fynd lawedeut c thou lo e mee sticke mee seeing lord requyreth willing affection wee resort free franke hart thinke wee accepteth aught handes wee come grudgingly repyningly yit pretend maruelous earnes ne towardes men howsoeuer world go wee alwayes haue backe nooke v wee would bee exempted obeying god therfore must take pleasure seruice must ioy delyght bondage must sweete lee v liberty yea realmes kingdomes world saint paule sayeth expresly maysters touching flesh bycause among lyghtes satan wherewith trubble world old tyme also make doctrine gospell hated put heresie intoo number men heades wee bee spirituall wee must bee subiect worldly transitorie policie nother state god child wee also haue seene tyme sort seditious mad headed people haue indeuered abolish principality take away tax impostes make euery man mayster himselfe lyke myce chaffe say grounded themselues vppon foundation asmuch god hath adopted v bee child world renewed intent wee bee graffed intoo bodye lord iesus christ thing ageinst reason contrary equytie yea euen ageinst honour god vnbeleeuers reigne ouer v name themselues faythfull souerintie ouer brother neyghboures lo uell laboreth driue intoo men heades gospell onfoundeth order world intent men hate abhorre agein say man better pleasant speech fit intyce great number folke paule therefore sayeth purposely although maysters temporall authoritie superioritie dooth fleshe say present world transitorye lyfe yit must bee defrauded ryght nother lorde iesus christ come make confuzed equalitie heere bee knowen great little make euery man hold himselfe quyietly callingpsal without looking lo tyly sayd psalme way make v humble meeke haue eye euery v owne calling person aduaunced authoritie honour aboue others bee puffed vp pryde presumption rather abace himselfe god assuring himselfe dubble bound vntoo exalting sort meaner sort maynteyne themselues meannesse without vsurping belongeth lykewise way father haue obedience child requisite treate gently husband also rule wyues concord freendlinesse prince abuse subiectes wretched beastes deuoure much therwithall meanest sort worldward consider god hath set state though appoynted place owne hand therfore let common sort aduaunce selues bee contented state say cause saint paule setteth downe saying expresly touching flesh bring maysters contempt reygning ouer slaues preuent obiections men myght alledge would seeke priuiledge exempt themselues obedience god order hath set therewith hee dooeth v vnderstande also subiection preiudice faythfull may continew still full libertie respect soules diuell vseth colour also sayeth seeing lord iesus christ hath shed blud purchace v freedome wee continew yea saint paule answereth theruntoo hath doone large circumstance fifth chapter first epistle corinthian bondage wee yeeld superiours alonly touching flesh soules conscience ceasse bee alwayes frank free god therfore chyldish ob ection say seeing lord iesus christ hath set v free men make v bond hath set v free touching bodyes bee principality lordshippes still world cannot bee must subiect othersome haue preheminence authoritie asmuch lord hath distinguished twoo gouernmentes bodie soule one spirituall bee gouerned word respect walking atteyne kingdome heauen commeth behauing ou selues towards men owne bodie wee must learne frame selues good policie let v assure selues yit state whit woorse efore god wee king prince rembled v yea thing wee doo hart ly seruing creature doo turne much exalting magnifying god need must bee man noble mynd stoope lowe obey willingly regarding great skilfull riche chaunge state wee see saint paule hath cut occasion dealing therfore let v learne told v heere first formest wee must haue god fastened eye knowe hath set v world serue one another sort wee must notwithstanding liue toogither humilitie disdeyne doo dewtie euen towards sufficient wee could wish wee take selues bee bee wee poynt certein wee euery v submit selues willingly according state god calleth v hold selues place hath put v saint paule would slaues tyme obedient maysters lesse excuce dayes seruants take wage let v compare one poore soules tolde handled rigorously maysters myght imprizon put stock racke dismember mayme yea kill greeuous cace yit bound lyfe deathexod limitation terme among iewes among god appoynted terme common generall lawe nation bond folk child continew bond euer father ryght owne chyld horse yee would say beast ouer young one came seede state bad hundred deathes yi man dooth alwayes couet libertie take ease eate bread quietnesse wretched slaues bit bread owne appoyntment touching person woorse captyues sayd afore yit god willeth commaundeth streytly beare state paciently performe dewties faythfully fall free cheerly hart bee sayd hyred seruants may warne themselues away haue wage payd haue serued yeere vsed treated much gently liberally poore slaues fayne labour euery one trade craft earned bread drunk water many tyme scarce fill shet vp cabanes inforced doo taskes serua te adaye stoope lowe beare state god hath layd vppon backes certein tootoo vnexcuzable much sayd subiectes towardes magistrate therfore inasmuch see lord spareth v wee bee much bound subiection paule speakes heere furthermore wee haue wey yit agein woordes speaketh franke free harted willingnesse impossible v fynd tast sauour state calling sorte euer bee except wee knowe bee benefyte welfare reape great profit seruing creature wee must therefore resort alwayes god ame marke namely seeyng hath bin good gracious v set v world maynteyne v heere shewe himselfe good father towardes v euer wee haue dooth come wee must shewe reuerence wee beare maiestie labour please wyse wee sticke bee subiect men take greefe scorne shall state bee greatly sweetened wee know god accepteth good woorth handes also cause setteth thing one ageinst another shewe contrarietie rather accord toogither sayeth wee must serue god behalfe maysters willingnesse afterwarde setteth downe god syde good melodie answereth well wee know god wyll seruantes obey maysters god must dispatch obiections myght hinder v stop v diuell tempteth v thinke thing straunge commaunded v intyceth v destruction let v take god wyll souereine welfare perfect happinesse assuring selues howsoeuer wee bee handled hand yit loueth v styll hath eye good v let serue one poynt wee haue perswasion well rooted harte certein willingnesse paule speaketh follow wee shall fynde lothnesse selues grudge ageinst wee see doo inforced doo thing ageinst wils grunt although dare bee aknowen yit harte fell nothing rancor therefore saint paule setteth downe willingnesse say wee doo thinges good freely shall make state lee pleasant doo nothing force constreynt cannot eschew necessitie obeying yit meane whyle bee tormenter themselues woorke themselues spyte could receyue sorrowes alledge wee bee handled roughly maysters superior magistrate yit wee bee sure god accepteth seruice asswageth greef wee conceyue wee haue doone dewtie wee take repaste praysing god wee take rest releefe giueth v infirmity besydes wee wyll euer haue eye heauenly lyfe take corage walke though wee haue neuer many stoppes yee see god child shall alwayes make hundred tymes better market doo dewtie seruing god freely go though nyne men hild say discharge coldly grudging repyning furthermore let v marke saint paule heere bringeth v three tymes backe vntoo god lord iesus christ rid v imagination wee myght conceyue men misbehaue themselues towardes v bond broken v therefore wee may exempt selues subiection wee example seruant haue mayster rigorous froward thinkes himselfe doo seruantes thinke themselues halfe quit maisters performe dewties towardes paule declareth expressely although maysters cruell doo meanes spare vnder hand yit superioritie diminished therby trew respect themselues maisters vnwoorthie haue authoritie wee shall see hereafter yit inferiour must holde himselfe styll vnder yoke bycause see god hath ordeyned effect thing wee haue beare mynd syde saint paul forgetteth seruants procure right belongeth commaundeth maysters doo lyke e matelyke say maisters consider although though ciuill lawes lay brydle looce neck yit dooth god graunt leaue doo list speaketh well one thing wee must beare well mynd maysters giueth rule namely must looke well rule bycause haue common mayster heauendeut rom b accepteth person touching seruants sayeth freends though yee haue recompence worlde yee would desyre let suffyze god accounteth slaues trewe yee bee despyzed worldwarde haue inheritaunce heauen lord accepteth seruis yee shall haue reward payd well yee kinges prince thing wee haue remember heere deede tyme serue whole discourse yit wee see first saint paule ment currye fauor greate riche sort maynteyning ryght ageinst slaues also laboreth syde bring lowelinesse meeknesse otherwyse myght haue aduaunced themselues much order ought bee obserued haue charge churche minister god word namely spare nother great small tell euery man dewtie sith accepting person god woord must bee handled roundly wee must bee dismayed hyghnesse authoritie estimation among men seeing god speaketh woord must pull downe loftinesse according saint paule speaketh second corinthians2 cor b sayth commission giuen shepherd minister gospell pull downe pryde men subdew ouer loftinesse need exalt themselues ageinst lord iesus christ step vp ageinst doctrine wil submit themselues yoke way minister god woord discharge office faythfully exhort meaner sort doo dewtie poore oppressed beare state paciently without replying howsoeuer fare without grudging ageinst men bycause dooing rebell ageinst god syde also telleth greate one must beast deuoure others eate vp must behaue themselues vpryghtly deede euen heathen men themselues listed speake according naturall equitie declared euen tyme became maysters abuze authoritie ouer seruants woords bondman slaues ought hild hyrelinges interteyned day sith paymins spake without hauing vnderstanding moother wit auorded excuce adayes trayned vp god schoole brotherhood betweene greate small maysters ought become fellowlie seruants bycause haue one hope endlesse lyfe haue power aboue others need set feete vppon throts abu ing ryght authoritie thing much ought one sort v think walk owne state calling inferiour sort grudge lord suffereth bee abandoned many wrong worldward bee mocked scorned although indure hundred tymes much yit repyne ageinst god bycause kicking ageinst spurre greater sort also doo lyke say consider neerer god hath drawen himselfe giuing preheminence also haue fashyon themselues image lykenesse shall wee fynd god goodnesse according wee see throughout scripture called fountaine lowelinesse gentlenesse mercy therefore let degree honour thinke cheefely theruppon certein discharge dewtie shall pay full deerely haue bin honorable world yit abuzed singular benefyte god sayd afore bycause one hard bee brought conformitie insomuch oppressed cannot refreyne grudging prouoked breake bondes let hild awe god woord earnest exhortation let great one also bee subdewed forget god woont doo ouershoote themselues farre thinke bee mortall men certein men bethinke themselues well owne state view themselues person meanest leade humilitie god woord must haue course cace brydle well one wee may lyue sort euery man according calling god may bee quietly obeyed wee herkening voyce desyre nothing performe dewtie towardes towardes creature vntyll wee bee come euerlastyng kingdome wee shall bee parttakers glory maiestie good thing let v fall downe maiestie good god acknowledgment sinnes praying voutsafe touch v trew lyuely repentance wee may bee sorie offending may make v hate vyces craue pardon hand intent may gouerne v holy spirit make v liue according holy commaundements beare weakenesse vntyll hee haue rid v quyte cleane let v saye almyghtie god heauenly father c xlv sermon third vppon sixth chapter moreouer brother bee strong lord mightinesse povver put complet harnesse god yee may stand ageinst assaultes diuell vvrestling ageinst fleshe blud ageinst principality ageinst povvers ageinst lordes vvorld euen ruler darknesse world ageinst spirituall vvickednesses vvhich heauenly place wee knowe prospertie dooth puffe men vp beare themselues hand ought bee priuiledged theyr state exempted common aray bee short ought doo lyst contrary part poorer sorte despyzed shaken thinke god hath good forgotten thereuppon cannot conceyue hath care therefore expedient drunken presumptuousnesse take ouermuch vppon vnder colour bee credit authority haue corages abated heare told haue mayster heauen punish though scape handes men syde requisyte comforted redye quayle bee tempted fall intoo despayre saint paule shewed heere telleth seruants neede bee afrayd god regardeth walke feare hath care accepteth seruice well though honorable state great dignitie worldward vntoo maysters sayeth haue superiour heauen must yeeld account greatnesse hyghnesse go payment al thing nothing god bycause thing beare great glosse countenance world doo vanish away come souerein iudge syde also heere followeth sayd another text1 thes c namely faynt harted must bee comforted else myght quayle bycause would seeme god regardeth speake despyzed worldward therefore must bee told god hath forgotten though bee keepe lowe yme behoueth euery v apply owne vse according state god shall haue set v wee bee trubbled wrongfully men make none account v men shake v wee imagin god hath giuen v ouer wee cannot call vppon syde also wee cannot serue free hart bycause wee thinke labour lost purpose therfore assayled temptation let v call lesson rememberance though wee bee afflicted world men laugh v scorne spit face bee short though wee indure reproche bee yit wee fayle bee safe keeping god bycause esteemeth v setteth store v end shewe dooth insomuch although wee linger pyne away withhold himselfe hidden v man myght deeme according naturall vnderstanding wee bee yee would say razed rememberance yit neuerthelesse hath hild v vnder whyle tryed humilitie obedience wee shall fynd walking faythfully vncorruptly feare shal bee admitted account end haue labored mooneshyne water say thing effect must beare mynd great personage world exalt themselues pryde able trample v vnder feete howbeeit let haue superioritie ouer others aduyze themselues well consider god hath giuen brydle without reseruing owne ryght himselfe great small must bee fayne appeere iudgment seate wilbe accepting person wherfore let riche let authoritie let haue aduantage aboue neyghbours remember wel saying accepting person god although world one man go another followes yit trumpet soundeth wee must come great iudge shalbee difference cause euen king prince brought poynt consideration psalmepsalr sayd yee bee god yee bee child hyghest bycause god hath ordeyned leeutenants set hygh degree trew must stand force tyme yit shall yee dye men sayeth one common people shall yee bee driuen knowe yee mortall men great gay shewes shall bee layd awater truth setting downe woord person ought put v well mynd bee temporall thing wee cannot bring v god though owne trew tha common speech take woord person another sense call man woman person scripture speakes meaneth thing without v rich state office nobilitie great birth thing men possesse world whereof may also bee bereft therefore sayd accepting person god much saye iudge v simply mortall men brittle frayle creature wee cannot sheeld selues one thing insomuch richest cannot bring treasure landes possession aduaunce themselues aboue others haue bin great dignitie shall say euery man trembled vnder mee geere shall bee nothing woorth afore god greatnesse authoritie world serue purpose euery man shall taken chyld adam let haue occasion exalt themselues beare well mynd thinges haue gloriousnesse worldward esteemed reputation shall fade away lyke smoke bee consumed nothing wee come bee iudged god therefore let men great small lyue humblenesse trustiames b c se saint iames sayth let small glory hyghnesse bycause god hath adopted v child although wee bee poore earthwoormes euen men themselues account v filth dung yit hath god voutsafed print marke v wee myght bee knowen child hath giuen v leaue call vpon father full mouth therefore wee haue iust cause glory notwithstanding wee lowe degree wee haue hyghnesse whereby god exalteth v aboue world contrary part saint iames sayeth great must glory lowenesse wheras vnbeleeuers bewitched pryde despyze god sayd afore doo beare themselues hand bee exempted lawe state set alone selfe rest world beleeuers must vnderstand dignitie excellencie world serueth tyme passeth away wee come god wee shall haue nother one thing clothe selues withall bee short thing scripture calleth person apparel clothing let v take similitude richly apparelled thinke scape god vnder colour gazeth owne gay fethers world woondereth beholde deceyueth much thing must bee layd asyde god calleth v iudgement agein poore folke scarsely haue wherwith couer halfe body yea fewe ragges torne cloutes must thinke themselues lesse esteemed god shall bee person say shall bee noth rich pouertie honour bacenesse wee must appeere wee bee say mortall men child adam effect wee haue gather vppon lesson saint paule hath shewed euery man dewtie particularly returneth agein generall doctrine sayd afore one rule common men without exception conteyned god lawe namely wee leade holy lyfe giuing selues ouer vnto seruis also loue one another liuing chastely soberly myldnesse honestie common sayd afterward euery man must haue eye owne calling husband hath speciall dewtie towards wyfe wyfe towards hir husband wee haue seene hertoofore saint paule hath layd foorth thing attempereth talk men saying moreouer brother bee strong lord wherin sheweth wee cannot giue selues seruing god without hardnesse must take peynes prepare selues thertoo trew wee whole sound nature vncorrupted would neuer dare v liue according god commaundement nay rather would whole pleasure accordingly faythfull doo feele experience god hath touched quicke cause also dooth lord iesus christ saymath yoke nother hard rough burthen heauie say desyreth nothing guyde v gentle aud louing meanes wee consider wee bee say vnable wee bee firme constat hold way god sheweth v surely wee shall well see without cause saint paule exhorteth v heere bee strong say haue exhorted hithertoo doo dewties knowe well euery shall fynde stubornnesse self shal able ouercome wicked lust fyghting manfully though weake yit think ought serue excuce passion one syde stubborne rebellious ageinst god selues syde frayle think shall quit god yee shalbee condemned sinnes neuerthelesse bee doone bee yee strong lord sayeth say wheras men doo welter sinnes think themselues discharged use thought affection rebellious ageinst ryghtuousnesse god knowing misery must mislyke selues seeke remedie strengthen selues say wee must inforce selues hee say hard thing walk aryght wee shall haue many impediment may diuell wil ceasse seeke meanes possible thrust v way wee shall haue store oppression vexation hath slyghtes ynow many besyds assayleth v one maner another haue wherwith resist therfore behoueth v get strength v howbeit sayth lord least men imagin themselues able furnish matter owne freewill owne cunning therefore bee yee strong lord sayeth yea myghtinesse power hee dooeth v wit god vtter power wee shal neede doubt victorie ageinst diuell practyze bee rechlesse ne fall asleepe wherfore let v call vppon god may help v succour v neede let twoo thing go toogither v wit first wakefulnesse care faythfull haue strengthen themselues syde hartie desyrousnesse call vppon god text well woorthie bee marked conteyneth greate matter fewe woords first wee see wee must bee slothfull wee couet rule lyfe according god forasmuch euery man beareth self desyre nothing shake care cast thing back say myght trubble v end wee bee nyce wee must mark first wee serue god wee must inforce selues much say must fyght ageinst diuell sayd afore ydle nother suffer v doo dewtie ease though wee walk vp downe foyre place set thornes cast log wayes stop v agein giue girds v shalbee ynough ouerthrow v hundred tymes wee step one pace vnlesse god ayd v forasmuch therfore wee cannot walk feare god without fyghting wee ought beare saint paules warning mynd furthermore intendeth also make v perceyue owne weaknesse wee knowe men doo beare much themselues seeke nothing welter pleasure also presume vppon owne strength beare theselues hand able worke wonder though stout could bee requyred cursed perswasion hath deceiued wretched al age meane hath freewill trotted euery man mouth paule telleth v heere wee haue neede bee strenthened saying importeth wee bee weake nature afterward expresseth self yit better saying lord wee must bee strong hath power giue therof vntoo v much needeth wee enterpryze thing without calling vppon wee shalbee punished rashnesse pryde saint paule therfore sheweth v men cast themselues decay ouerweening imagining themselues haue haue conceyt turneth away calling vppon god myght bee sayd heere superfluous exhortation bid v bee strong lord man able vphold self lyeth body power doo yit wee feele effect god woorketh wyse v wee doo thing dooeth yit must woorking need bee amyable v haue liued holily may haue bin mirrour holinesse vertew may well bee sayd hath doone deede wee bee timber log therfore wee doo good yea yit must wee vnderstand woorking commeth elswhere selues lyeth knot cace bee demaunded whether men doo good yea themselues owne selfmouing owne kynd bycause bee guyded holie ghoste bee demaunded whethr men doo euill yea bee giuen wholy common byasse men doo euill themselues roote remayneth blame ryghtly imputed vntoo must fetch wyndlasses aboue beneath fynd tryflyng shiftes whosoeuer hath doone euill shall abyde alwayes condemnation let v consider well god woorketh v wee doo good prayse thereof ought ryght bee giuen howbeeit although bee nothing v syde wee serue god yit notwithstanding paule exhorteth v vayne saying wee must bee strengthened godphil wee must bee lazie speaketh another place sayth woorke saluation feare trembling god giueth wyll abilitie performe according good pleasure freely owne mercy saying seemeth straunge first blush paule wylleth v woorke saluation v correcteth myght bee conceyued presumption ouerweening saying must bee done trembling wee must walke feare say wee must distrust selues yea bee vtterly abashed assuring selues wee cannot stirre one little ngers thinke one good thought sayeth another place2 cor b except god giue v aboue afterward confirmeth matter yit better addeth conclusion god giueth wyll performance wyll god dooeth yit ceasse wee doo also yea haue declared already bee short holy scripture sayeth god doth renew v wee bee begotten agein holy spirit wee begin haue good mynd bee well inclyned intent wee bee slothfull ydle intent god bee glorifyed wee imagin selues bee woorkers owne saluation yeeld honour good hath put intoo v howsoeuer world go yit must wee bee watchfull saye wee must keepe good watch ageinst diuell indeuer giue selues goodnesse euery v inforce selues wee must imprizon owne wit wicked make obedient god yit must bee acknowledged bee adding woordes myghtye povver god make v ouercome distrust wee see wee bee geuen bee hart insomuch wee cannot compasse thinges wee would commaundeth v wee conclude end wee must needes quayle contrarywyse saint paule sayeth god vtter myghty victorious power according sayd syde stronger world seeing god taketh part vpholdeth v power let v feare bee surpryzed satan euer hee deuyze ageinst v whatsoeuer distress betyde vs2 cor c end wee shall ouercome euen resting vppon god inuincible power truth god perfecteth power weaknesse say woorketh wyse meane go limping plukt backe stumble step man pace awry start way yee see lordes assisting v holy spirit wyse holdeth v styll awe giue v occasi n humble selues weaknesse therfore mingled strength god assistence end wee knowe neede wee haue call vppon flee refuge wee bee redye ynough selues barken god glory therefore god fayne waken v say vntoo v wretched creature yee bee forlorne hundred thousand tymes hild yee hand lordes leani g infirmity v drawe v subdew v meeknesse wee may haue matter prayse suffereth falles bee deadly agein wee seeke euery minute houre knowing helped v vp agein hild v feete wee perish without mercye cause vntoo paules former saying wee must also ioyne sentence god doth deede leaue weaknesse v long wee lyue world yit ceasseth vtter inuincible power making v get vpper hand wee must dwell vppon concluzion satan hath wrought vttermost yit must wee marche neuerthelesse keepe way iournyes end onely sayd god humble v haue pitye vppon v also power shal shewe selfe succoring v single common operation myghtye power say power shall ouercome lettes world wee see diuersitie betweene doctrine papistes doctrine follow grounded vppon holy scripture blynd wretch say woorke woonders freewill deede giue little snippet vntoo god saying supplyeth wantes bycause bee inclined euill vyce bee restreyned god therefore pretie fellowe help dead lift meane whyle owne freewill naturall power beares sway haue made vttermost owne strength yit doo men dwell alwayes doubt happe hold one houre slumble neuer get vp agein contrariwyse wee hold opinion man must bee vtterly beaten downe wee bee taught holy ghost wee may haue one drop power resident selues bee vtterly emptied wee poynt lord sheweth v remedye wee repayre acknowledge wantes bee redy beg wee haue mouthes open bee pu vp mynd rather vtterly emptye dooth lord assure v fayle v wee shall haue whereof presume howbeeit manner papistes make brag aferwarde come short theyr reckening put vtter shame part wee haue acknowledged nothing wee bee nothing doo wee resort vntoo god glory ageinst satan ageinst assaultes giueth vppon v ageinst munition hel ageinst impedimentes temptation worlde thus yee see wee ought put lesson saint paules vre hath spoken myghtye power god addeth vvee must arme selues vvith complet harnesse say long none selues wee bee wel armed weaponed ouercome satan assaultes owne negligence cause wee bee often vanquished foyled god promiseth succour v power measure wee shall get vpper hand also putteth meanes intoo handes armeth v yit notwithstanding wee hang vp armour vppon wall maruell wee bee taken vnwares bee vnable resist pinch wee hold scorne vse meanes god offereth v neere hand armour saint paule shewe dew place let suffize v knowe intent whereas sayd wee must bee armed god complet harnesse rebuke quicken vp rechlesnesse letting thing alone offereth v deede wee lyke well man tell v god redye foreward succour v neede doubt victorie ageinst enemy long syde accept geere willingly meane whyle wee bee contented sit styll v incounter enemie farre strong v yit must wee cace incounter hand hand wee would god armour lye styll bee prepared v without vsing cause wee commaunded put say apylye vse sith sta e wee must maynteyne battell pleaseth god wee bee armed diuell come vppon v vnprouded saint paule onely vseth woord armor harnesse also addeth furniture say wee must bee armed top toe shalbe set foorth particularly yit better heerafter howbeeit meaning text vnthankfulnesse knowen much god armeth v poyntes nothing missing except fault bee selues deede wee sticke put part armour god giueth v howbeeit one man clap morion countenance take nother target corselet thing else another catch vp swoord third halberd meane whyle euery want many thing haue neede wee perhaps apply part god armour vse say wee vtterly reiect refuze grace offereth v none v armeth himselfe doo say fenced vertues god giueth certein ryght hand left aboue beneathe god ordeyneth meanes v fyght withall sufficient wee despyze vpon knowledge want receiue thing giueth v liberally intent wee bee prouoked arme selues receyue helpes god giueth v paule addeth yee may vvithstand assaultes uell heere confirmeth matter spake afore wit wee cannot serue god owne ease though nothing let v man may go woorke day long shall go foreward quietly bycause distrubbled obedience faythfull yeeld god diuell ceasseth trubble woorke thousand spytes incomberances therefore wee desyre walke feare god wee must bee armed ee may bee ready battell enemye wyll neuer let v rest cause saint paule setteth downe many assaultes satan say satan assayling v bring v wickednesse twyce away maynteyneth continuall battell hath giuen v e alarum one syde commes agein insomuch besydes owne inforcing strengthening selues wee haue neede armour repulse enemy syde soeuer assayle v agein amplyfyeth yit better saying fyghting ageinst flesh blud also ageinst power principal tie aire ageinst lord world ageinst wicked spirit fyght heauen ageinst v commonly wee haue doo enemy greatly able anoy v wee feare doo v harme wee despyze oftentymes cause yee would esteeme bee valeantest world doo come short home bycause despyzed enemye saint paule telleth v haue maner wyghts mortall men yit wee feare man hate v although bee great abilitie yit haue wee flea eare say wee think wisdome preuent thing enemie practyze ageinst v specially enemyes myghtie strong wee vnable stand ageinst repulse wee much amazed may yit mortall men wee howbeit paul tels v haue fyght ageinst mortal ageinst enemy doo farre passe cause doth cal power principality giuing authoritie though ouer hand v alredye wee fyght enemye ouer head would trubble v curstly diuells haue aduauntage v bee named euen king world besyds haue thousand wyles policy therfore sayd assayle v force also lay many stales ambush intrappe v wee could scape wee stoode vppon gard heere standeth v hand bee throughly waked though wee asleepe also swound yit notwithstanding warning dooth little boote v wee see cold wee bee buskling selues battell saint peter telleth v lyke1 pet b though vse
